description: Adobe Dreamweaver Creative Cloud is used by web designers and front-end developers and allows you to visualize your site in real-time as you code. Its design surface combines with integration of Bootstrap and code editor and integrates robust site management tools for easy design, code, and management of websites and mobile content. This course covers exam objectives for the Adobe Certified Associate (ACA) certification.
name: Dreamweaver CC
subtitle: Web Design Application

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim discuss the basics of DreamWeaver. They explain preferences, the Welcome screen, history and customizing the Workspace. They look at panels including docking, collapsing, groups and creating new layouts.
episodes.title: Introduction to Dreamweaver
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2

Welcome to another exciting
episode here at ITProTV.

3
00:00:14.981 --> 00:00:19.423
I'm your host, Wes Bryan, and in today's

10

11

12

13

14

>> Very good.
So anytime we dive into a product or

15

a technology, we typically have some
basics that we have to go over and Jim,

16

17

Wes, and a very good point.

18

So at this point, I'd like to

22

23

Now, this is one of the few applications

24

And I find it to be one of the few
applications that is extremely useful

25

26
00:01:30.500 --> 00:01:33.490
The other applications that we've used for

27

Adobe don't always facilitate

here it's essential because of the fact

30

31

32

42

But here, in the center, we have

43

And it's gonna give you the coding

44

45

So we have some CSS files, HTML, PHP, XML.

46
00:02:27.384 --> 00:02:30.334
And we'll talk a little bit about

47

48

We also have some new fluid

49

55

56

57
00:03:09.300 --> 00:03:11.348

58

59
00:03:14.460 --> 00:03:18.460

60

And I'm going to choose in this

61
00:03:21.060 --> 00:03:24.000

62
00:03:24.000 --> 00:03:25.660

63

64

65

66

67

68

71

72

73

So this is really good.

74
00:04:04.640 --> 00:04:07.850
Now, I can assign a document

75

76

And that'll give me the opportunity to

77
00:04:15.700 --> 00:04:21.609
I can also attach a cascading style sheets

78
00:04:21.609 --> 00:04:23.453

79

80

We also have the bootstrap option, like I

81
00:04:31.887 --> 00:04:36.291

82
00:04:36.291 --> 00:04:39.034

83
00:04:39.034 --> 00:04:42.281
Now, that I've gone through that process,

84

I wanna show you real quick,

85
00:04:45.970 --> 00:04:47.971
I have the ability to go
out to the Internet and

86
00:04:47.971 --> 00:04:51.340
I wanna make sure that this is

87
00:04:51.340 --> 00:04:53.310
So here's the interface

88
00:04:53.310 --> 00:04:56.840

91

00:05:07.660 --> 00:05:11.880
So here we are in the PC environment, and

00:05:11.880 --> 00:05:14.950

00:05:16.750 --> 00:05:20.360

107
00:05:53.630 --> 00:05:55.876

00:06:50.670 --> 00:06:52.270

127
00:06:52.270 --> 00:06:54.850

128
00:06:54.850 --> 00:07:00.240

134
00:07:18.872 --> 00:07:22.860

135
00:07:22.860 --> 00:07:25.300

136

137
00:07:26.690 --> 00:07:28.320

138
00:07:28.320 --> 00:07:30.690
And the last item is my preferences list.

139
00:07:30.690 --> 00:07:33.324
Now, the preferences

140
00:07:33.324 --> 00:07:35.720
But getting there is what's different.

141
00:07:35.720 --> 00:07:38.181
So that helps out a lot.

142

150
00:08:04.909 --> 00:08:09.660
Now this was unique to the Mac, did not

151
00:08:09.660 --> 00:08:12.510
So there is no applications
frame that's available.

152
00:08:12.510 --> 00:08:15.370
And if I want to reset everything back,

153

154
00:08:19.520 --> 00:08:22.730

156
00:08:25.660 --> 00:08:27.360

00:08:27.360 --> 00:08:30.020
If I go here back to the PC side, and

158

00:08:33.850 --> 00:08:38.100
So this is one of the major

161
00:08:41.260 --> 00:08:46.110
Now, I live in the Mac world, so
I spent a lot of time on the Mac version.

162
00:08:46.110 --> 00:08:48.920

the configuration and I'll configure on

164
00:08:53.290 --> 00:08:55.910

165
00:08:55.910 --> 00:09:02.000

166
00:09:03.210 --> 00:09:08.410
So, to start, we talk about
the menu bar here across the top.

167
00:09:08.410 --> 00:09:09.820
So, we talked about the menu bar and

168
00:09:09.820 --> 00:09:11.470

from the application, but

169
00:09:11.470 --> 00:09:14.100
below that it's called
the application bar.

170
00:09:14.100 --> 00:09:16.500
So on the Mac there's
not a lot going on here.

171
00:09:16.500 --> 00:09:19.710
The application bar is this section
right here with those default, and

172
00:09:19.710 --> 00:09:27.740
then I can synchronize between my Creative
Cloud services and the Adobe Application.

173
00:09:27.740 --> 00:09:31.860
When I go back to the PC side,
okay, here's my menu bar.

174
00:09:31.860 --> 00:09:35.090
But all the way to the right

175
00:09:35.090 --> 00:09:37.490

176
00:09:37.490 --> 00:09:40.880
And I still have the ability to chose

177
00:09:40.880 --> 00:09:42.200
I have the ability to sync.

178
00:09:42.200 --> 00:09:44.460
And you can see right now it's
got a little exclamation point,

179
00:09:44.460 --> 00:09:47.600
which means that I haven't synchronized
in this particular application.

180
00:09:49.630 --> 00:09:54.300
Now, where it says default,
I call that a work space

181
00:09:54.300 --> 00:09:57.300
because you might be sharing your computer
with other people, or you might want to

182
00:09:57.300 --> 00:10:00.629
change the work space depending on what
your work flow is going to be like.

183
00:10:01.730 --> 00:10:02.860
And I will tell you,

184
00:10:02.860 --> 00:10:07.370
I like to change my environment to
suit the workflow that I enjoy.

185
00:10:07.370 --> 00:10:10.620
And I've enjoyed all the way back to CS5.

186
00:10:10.620 --> 00:10:14.900
So, what you're gonna see me do today is
to learn how to manipulate the panels.

187
00:10:14.900 --> 00:10:20.120
But at the same The same time I'm going
to teach you the workflow that I use.

188
00:10:20.120 --> 00:10:23.070
So we are using the default workspace and

189
00:10:23.070 --> 00:10:25.520

190
00:10:25.520 --> 00:10:31.120

00:10:31.120 --> 00:10:34.600
What I'd like to do is I would like

00:10:34.600 --> 00:10:37.450

193
00:10:37.450 --> 00:10:42.490

195

And what I'm looking for

199
00:10:58.680 --> 00:11:01.790

00:11:01.790 --> 00:11:02.330

202
00:11:06.540 --> 00:11:10.570
Now, I do like the files panel

00:11:10.570 --> 00:11:12.700

204
00:11:12.700 --> 00:11:14.350
And so now it's Files, DOM, Assets.

205
00:11:14.350 --> 00:11:17.120
So you can rearrange the tabs

206

Now I maximize this by double-clicking,

CC Libraries and expand that back down.

00:11:26.250 --> 00:11:27.640
And here it is.

210

Now Insert Insert is one that I like

I'm currently working untitled document,

212
00:11:36.890 --> 00:11:38.300
I'd like to move that above there.

So I'm gonna pull that out, make it float,

214
00:11:42.880 --> 00:11:46.540

218
00:11:59.520 --> 00:12:01.420
So I have all the options

219
00:12:01.420 --> 00:12:05.359
And this is the HTML section,

So, similar configuration.

00:23:40.742 --> 00:23:43.600
And there's my code, just like before,
and we're good to go.

448
00:23:43.600 --> 00:23:45.110
>> And
I can see where that would come in handy,

449
00:23:45.110 --> 00:23:48.150
Jim, if you're moving between
two different platforms.

450
00:23:48.150 --> 00:23:51.000
Maybe you got a work computer that's
got Windows but you come home,

451
00:23:51.000 --> 00:23:52.780
maybe you're using your Mac at home.

452
00:23:52.780 --> 00:23:57.137
Where you can kinda have some consistency,
if it will be, in the user interface,

453
00:23:57.137 --> 00:23:59.220
user experience, right?

454
00:23:59.220 --> 00:24:03.990
>> That's absolutely correct, the point of
a workspace is to have that consistency so

455
00:24:03.990 --> 00:24:07.570
theres familiarity with
where things are located and

456
00:24:07.570 --> 00:24:09.310
you'll be able to find it much easier.

457
00:24:09.310 --> 00:24:13.925
This is a workflow that I've used since I
started using Dreamweaver back in 1997,

458
00:24:13.925 --> 00:24:18.345
because that's how the arrangement was,
the Insert panel was always on the top and

459
00:24:18.345 --> 00:24:20.579
the Properties was always at the bottom.

460
00:24:20.579 --> 00:24:25.427
So a lot of these are happening
because of the fact that I'm just so

461
00:24:25.427 --> 00:24:29.680
used to it it's become routine for
me, and I enjoy that.

462
00:24:29.680 --> 00:24:30.900
But you're absolutely right.

463
00:24:30.900 --> 00:24:33.220
If you move from one
workstation to another,

464
00:24:33.220 --> 00:24:37.310
the workspace will give you that
consistency and it'll help you out.

465
00:24:37.310 --> 00:24:38.690
Good questions.

466
00:24:38.690 --> 00:24:39.720
Okay, fantastic.

467
00:24:39.720 --> 00:24:44.490
So we've got the workspace,
we can move our panels around,

468
00:24:44.490 --> 00:24:47.310
we can make them float,
we can close them down individually.

469
00:24:47.310 --> 00:24:51.260
And we can save the workspace so
that way we can use it in the future and

470
00:24:51.260 --> 00:24:56.810
you can make it so that way, you have
this reusable space for you every time.

471
00:24:56.810 --> 00:25:00.430
>> All right, thank you, Jim,
for a good introduction there.

472
00:25:00.430 --> 00:25:03.860
But it does look like we're gonna come
to the end of another episode here, but

473
00:25:03.860 --> 00:25:06.350
before we do that,
do you have other additional words?

474
00:25:06.350 --> 00:25:10.440
>> Yeah, the point of
discussion is that I would like

475
00:25:10.440 --> 00:25:13.380
to say that if you feel comfortable in
the environment that you're working with,

476
00:25:13.380 --> 00:25:17.840
these tools will really help benefit you,
and configuring your workspace,

477
00:25:17.840 --> 00:25:22.230
configuring the layout of everything,
is really basically for comfort.

478
00:25:22.230 --> 00:25:24.010
>> And it's basically to provide you,

479
00:25:24.010 --> 00:25:28.600
the user, a space that you're gonna
wanna work in and always come back to.

480
00:25:28.600 --> 00:25:31.370
>> All right, well, Jim,
we appreciate your information on that and

481
00:25:31.370 --> 00:25:33.050
we do appreciate you, the viewer.

482
00:25:33.050 --> 00:25:35.107
We're gonna go ahead and
sign out here at ITProTV.

483
00:25:35.107 --> 00:25:37.148
I've been your host Wes Bryan.

484
00:25:37.148 --> 00:25:37.962
>> And I'm Jim Searles.

485
00:25:37.962 --> 00:25:40.250
>> And we'll see you next time.

486
00:25:40.250 --> 00:25:48.400
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim demonstrate how to create a new site inside of DreamWeaver. They explore configuring appropriate folders for all site files, version control and the Files panel. They talk about naming conventions to organize content, tips to help make the user more productive and efficient.
episodes.title: Creating a Site in Dreamweaver
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.004 --> 00:00:10.004
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:11.809 --> 00:00:14.980
Welcome back to another exciting
episode here at IT Pro TV.

3
00:00:14.980 --> 00:00:16.100
I'm your host, Wes Bryan.

4
00:00:16.100 --> 00:00:20.530
And in today's episode, we are moving
through our DreamWeaver series.

5
00:00:20.530 --> 00:00:21.030
That's right.

6
00:00:21.030 --> 00:00:22.280
The Creative Cloud 2015.

7
00:00:22.280 --> 00:00:25.840
Joining me back in the studios again
is none other than Mr.Jim Searles.

8
00:00:25.840 --> 00:00:27.500
Jim, how you doing today, sir?

9
00:00:27.500 --> 00:00:28.370
>> I'm doing great, Wes.

10
00:00:28.370 --> 00:00:29.770
Thank you for having me today.

11
00:00:29.770 --> 00:00:34.630
And thank you to ITPROTV for welcoming me
back so we can talk about DreamWeaver,

12
00:00:34.630 --> 00:00:36.490
an application that I enjoy.

13
00:00:36.490 --> 00:00:40.600
And we can talk about creating a site,
and when we talk about creating sites,

14
00:00:40.600 --> 00:00:44.100
we're not necessarily talking about
the website out on the internet.

15
00:00:44.100 --> 00:00:47.870
We're talking about sites that
dream weaver can manage and

16
00:00:47.870 --> 00:00:52.210
the file's and assets we use for
our development.

17
00:00:52.210 --> 00:00:56.700
So I'd like to dive right in and
get to my computer here so

18
00:00:56.700 --> 00:01:00.810
we can look at the multiple ways
to go in and create a site.

19
00:01:00.810 --> 00:01:03.120
I'm gonna start by going to the site menu.

20
00:01:03.120 --> 00:01:07.650
When I click on the site menu here across
the top I can click the site item and

21
00:01:07.650 --> 00:01:10.390
I can choose new site or managed sites.

22
00:01:10.390 --> 00:01:11.280
If I choose new site,

23
00:01:11.280 --> 00:01:15.510
it will give me the opportunity to name
the site and find the site folder.

24
00:01:15.510 --> 00:01:17.090
I'm gonna show you another method,
so just for

25
00:01:17.090 --> 00:01:19.830
this moment in time I'm
going to cancel out of this.

26
00:01:19.830 --> 00:01:21.470
The other way you can go into and

27
00:01:21.470 --> 00:01:25.960
create a new site is to go into the files
panel in the bottom right hand corner.

28
00:01:25.960 --> 00:01:28.400
In the files panel in
the bottom right hand corner,

29
00:01:28.400 --> 00:01:34.110
I have the ability to go to this
drop down and choose Manage Sites so

30
00:01:34.110 --> 00:01:37.840
We can click on that, and then,
we can create a new site right here.

31
00:01:39.150 --> 00:01:42.120
So same dialogue box that we saw before.

32
00:01:42.120 --> 00:01:45.620
Now, the third way that we can do this,
I might cancel out of this again,

33
00:01:45.620 --> 00:01:51.510
is to literally expand this out and
then to go into this site menu here.

34
00:01:51.510 --> 00:01:54.970
And the site menu here is almost
exactly like the other site menu.

35
00:01:54.970 --> 00:01:59.870
I'd like to point out that in the Windows
version of Dreamweaver when I do maximize

36
00:01:59.870 --> 00:02:05.460
the files panel the files panel takes
over the entire Dreamweaver application.

37
00:02:05.460 --> 00:02:08.700
If I pull this down you'll see
that my desktop is behind it so

38
00:02:08.700 --> 00:02:13.880
technically I'm now inside the files and
files is now the predominant application.

39
00:02:13.880 --> 00:02:17.940
If I want to revert back to dream weaver,
I can click on this icon again to collapse

40
00:02:17.940 --> 00:02:22.720
and show local files icon, and I can get
back to the dream weaver application.

41
00:02:22.720 --> 00:02:24.850
So we're going to go back to the site
menu here and create a site.

42
00:02:26.100 --> 00:02:30.340
So under new site, I have a couple of
different options here on the left.

43
00:02:30.340 --> 00:02:34.390
So the options that I have is site,
servers, version control and

44
00:02:34.390 --> 00:02:35.079
advanced settings.

45
00:02:36.110 --> 00:02:39.460
The site is where I'm actually going to
name my sites, and I'm going to point

46
00:02:39.460 --> 00:02:43.860
to the files and folders that
I'm going to use as my assets.

47
00:02:43.860 --> 00:02:47.670
Now, I can give it any name that I want,
and I'm going to call it My Sample Site.

48
00:02:50.610 --> 00:02:53.400
And then the local site folder,
I can click the little

49
00:02:53.400 --> 00:02:57.690
folder icon here to the right to point to
the file folder that I want to got to.

50
00:02:57.690 --> 00:03:02.160
In this case, I'm just going to place it
on the desktop, and I'm going to create,

51
00:03:03.280 --> 00:03:08.590
or click Select Folder and
here we have the information that we need.

52
00:03:08.590 --> 00:03:12.050
Now if I was going to
connect to an FTP server,

53
00:03:12.050 --> 00:03:15.350
if I was going to connect to files
that I might have out on the Internet,

54
00:03:15.350 --> 00:03:17.930
I would go to servers, and
then I would have to create this.

55
00:03:17.930 --> 00:03:20.470
But this we're gonna
discuss at a later time.

56
00:03:20.470 --> 00:03:23.920
Also down here there's
some advance settings

57
00:03:23.920 --> 00:03:26.580
that you might want to consider looking at
and we'll take a look at that right now.

58
00:03:26.580 --> 00:03:30.960
So I'm going to click on this
triangle that's called a twirly in

59
00:03:30.960 --> 00:03:35.835
the Adobe vernacular, and I'm going to see
that I have many different options here.

60
00:03:35.835 --> 00:03:38.975
Again, these are a little more advanced
for our conversation today, but

61
00:03:38.975 --> 00:03:40.975
I'm going to click on advanced settings.

62
00:03:40.975 --> 00:03:45.805
And I do want to specify where my image
folder is going to lie eventually.

63
00:03:45.805 --> 00:03:51.315
The point here is that, any image assets
that I use, I can tell Dreamer right away

64
00:03:51.315 --> 00:03:55.170
where those files are located, and it will
use them and point to that all the time.

65
00:03:55.170 --> 00:04:00.160
I can also specify the web URL for
the site that I'm creating.

66
00:04:00.160 --> 00:04:04.290
So, I can specify the web address here,
the domain, and list that here as well.

67
00:04:04.290 --> 00:04:04.790
Okay?
But

68
00:04:04.790 --> 00:04:08.620
at this point in time, just having
the site created, having the name, and

69
00:04:08.620 --> 00:04:11.640
pointing to the folder is what I'd like
to do right now, so I'm gonna click Save.

70
00:04:12.900 --> 00:04:15.830
Once I do that, it is going to tell
me I've chosen another location,

71
00:04:15.830 --> 00:04:19.170
that I've, in this case,
that I exist on another site I've created.

72
00:04:19.170 --> 00:04:24.120
So I'm going to click OK, and it's going
to find the files within that location.

73
00:04:24.120 --> 00:04:27.880
Now, I did have a folder on the desktop,
It's called Cleanup, and because of that,

74
00:04:27.880 --> 00:04:30.120
it's now showing up in the files panel.

75
00:04:30.120 --> 00:04:34.180
And that's important to understand
because this is how Dream Weaver manages.

76
00:04:34.180 --> 00:04:37.900
The files that are available to
it based on what we just gave it.

77
00:04:37.900 --> 00:04:40.890
We gave it a location and
now it's finding those files.

78
00:04:40.890 --> 00:04:44.340
Also what you'll find is if I
go inside of this pull-down,

79
00:04:44.340 --> 00:04:47.450
you will see that my sample
site now exists in, a list.

80
00:04:47.450 --> 00:04:50.890
So at any time I can swap between
multiple sites and view that information.

81
00:04:53.280 --> 00:04:58.650
Now, the point of this is to be able
to have Dream Weaver manage and

82
00:04:58.650 --> 00:05:00.490
organize our files.

83
00:05:00.490 --> 00:05:03.930
So if I go out of Dream Weaver, and

84
00:05:03.930 --> 00:05:09.139
let's say I create a new folder out
here and I'm just going to call it Test.

85
00:05:10.450 --> 00:05:14.380
So now, I have a folder called test and
on the desk top, and

86
00:05:14.380 --> 00:05:15.340
then I go back into Dreamweaver.

87
00:05:15.340 --> 00:05:20.320
There is no folder here for test,
so because of that, I have to go up

88
00:05:20.320 --> 00:05:24.020
on the menu here inside the files panel,
and I have to click the Refresh icon.

89
00:05:24.020 --> 00:05:28.060
So I'm gonna click Refresh and now you're
going to see that test has shown up, or

90
00:05:28.060 --> 00:05:31.360
I could wait a few second and
it finally refreshes.

91
00:05:31.360 --> 00:05:35.200
But the point here is is that Dream Weaver
was not able to see that until

92
00:05:35.200 --> 00:05:36.640
the refresh happened.

93
00:05:36.640 --> 00:05:39.810
So if you work outside of
Dream Weaver to manage your assets

94
00:05:39.810 --> 00:05:43.900
that could be problematic when you're
trying to work in your files panel.

95
00:05:43.900 --> 00:05:48.360
So instead a better methodology,
if I could speak here it would be great

96
00:05:48.360 --> 00:05:52.890
Is to right click inside this
area in the files panel.

97
00:05:52.890 --> 00:05:56.090
And to choose to create your new files or
your folders.

98
00:05:56.090 --> 00:05:59.430
And I'd like to set up my folder
structure at this point in time for

99
00:05:59.430 --> 00:06:01.390
all the assets I'm going to use.

100
00:06:01.390 --> 00:06:03.820
So I'm gonna start here by
creating a new folder, and

101
00:06:03.820 --> 00:06:07.630
we're going to call this My Style.

102
00:06:07.630 --> 00:06:10.310
So I'm gonna do _Styles.

103
00:06:10.310 --> 00:06:14.660
Now, basically, what I'm doing is,
I'm placing an underscore in front of

104
00:06:14.660 --> 00:06:19.080
the name of the folder, because I want
this, alphabetically, to move to the top.

105
00:06:19.080 --> 00:06:22.520
These are one of those important folders,
where I'm gonna have all the assets for

106
00:06:22.520 --> 00:06:25.240
my website, so
it's important that I find it.

107
00:06:25.240 --> 00:06:28.050
So, having the underscore in front of
this should move it up to the top.

108
00:06:29.140 --> 00:06:32.260
Also, I'm gonna create another folder for
images.

109
00:06:32.260 --> 00:06:38.950
So I'm gonna do underscore images and you
have to be careful, I had style selected.

110
00:06:38.950 --> 00:06:42.010
So now, it's trying to place this
image folder inside of styles and

111
00:06:42.010 --> 00:06:44.530
I'm gonna show you here that I
should be able to move that out.

112
00:06:44.530 --> 00:06:47.190
So I'm gonna do images and you can
they're subordinate to each other and

113
00:06:47.190 --> 00:06:50.370
there's a minus here and
I can collapse that down and hide it.

114
00:06:50.370 --> 00:06:54.180
But what I'd like to do is move it out,
so literally using Dreamweaver,

115
00:06:54.180 --> 00:06:58.600
I can pull this out and
move it onto its own area here.

116
00:06:58.600 --> 00:07:02.840
The blue bar tells me where I'm
putting it and it's making it so

117
00:07:02.840 --> 00:07:06.530
that I can move it out of
that folder as I right-click.

118
00:07:08.674 --> 00:07:14.386
All right, so I'm trying to move
that out Not to the subordinate,

119
00:07:14.386 --> 00:07:19.330
I don't want it to be inside a test and
it's not working.

120
00:07:19.330 --> 00:07:22.400
So here's what I'm gonna do,
I'm just gonna delete the folder and

121
00:07:22.400 --> 00:07:28.290
I'm going to recreate it without
having the styles folder selected.

122
00:07:28.290 --> 00:07:31.350
So to delete I have to go
to the edit option and

123
00:07:31.350 --> 00:07:33.289
choose the sub menu that's available here.

124
00:07:35.020 --> 00:07:37.290
And it's gonna say, do you really
want to delete this selected file?

125
00:07:37.290 --> 00:07:38.380
In this case, it's a folder.

126
00:07:38.380 --> 00:07:39.620
I'm gonna say Yes.

127
00:07:39.620 --> 00:07:43.250
Again, Dreamweaver's trying to keep track
of what's going on with your assets, so

128
00:07:43.250 --> 00:07:46.480
it's making sure that you're doing
what you're supposed to be doing.

129
00:07:46.480 --> 00:07:49.450
So again,
if I select here the root folder, and

130
00:07:49.450 --> 00:07:52.110
I choose right-click > New Folder.

131
00:07:52.110 --> 00:07:54.450
It should now be its own folder.

132
00:07:54.450 --> 00:07:57.760
So I'm gonna do _images.

133
00:07:57.760 --> 00:08:01.454
The next item is going to be for
our fonts, so if you have any fonts that

134
00:08:01.454 --> 00:08:05.278
you're working with, I need to make
sure that I got my route selected,

135
00:08:05.278 --> 00:08:07.867
right-click > choose New folder, _fonts.

136
00:08:11.079 --> 00:08:15.398
And the other folder that I'd like to
have is my scripts because you might have

137
00:08:15.398 --> 00:08:16.200
JavaScript.

138
00:08:16.200 --> 00:08:20.720
You might have PHP or some other scripts
that you are using to access data.

139
00:08:20.720 --> 00:08:24.075
So I'm gonna add another folder here and
we're call this ones scripts.

140
00:08:30.675 --> 00:08:31.650
Okay.

141
00:08:31.650 --> 00:08:35.330
So these are the basic folders that
I use when I create the word say.

142
00:08:35.330 --> 00:08:38.990
And this allows me to have what I need for
assets, and

143
00:08:38.990 --> 00:08:41.180
to place those assets in
the appropriate folder.

144
00:08:41.180 --> 00:08:43.320
You can name these whatever you want.

145
00:08:43.320 --> 00:08:47.520
This is specific to you and
to what your workload dictates.

146
00:08:47.520 --> 00:08:51.410
It allows you to find what you're looking
for based on the name of the folder, so

147
00:08:51.410 --> 00:08:52.350
that's very important.

148
00:08:52.350 --> 00:08:55.840
>> Now Jim I noticed that you put
underscores on every one of those folders

149
00:08:55.840 --> 00:08:59.560
you create, is this a good practice
>> Practice if you have multiple projects,

150
00:08:59.560 --> 00:09:02.010
or maybe multiple sites you're
working on at the same time.

151
00:09:02.010 --> 00:09:05.880
Can your hierarchy get kind of
convoluted and make it less productive,

152
00:09:05.880 --> 00:09:08.080
if you can't find those folders easier?

153
00:09:08.080 --> 00:09:09.430
Is that why you're doing that?

154
00:09:09.430 --> 00:09:11.080
>> That's absolutely correct.

155
00:09:11.080 --> 00:09:13.050
If I didn't put the underscores
in front of those names,

156
00:09:13.050 --> 00:09:16.360
they would be stored alphabetically,
with the HTML files that I'm using.

157
00:09:16.360 --> 00:09:19.060
Or assets that I might have in the root.

158
00:09:19.060 --> 00:09:21.750
And what this does is,
it isolates those files and

159
00:09:21.750 --> 00:09:23.520
places them at the top of the list.

160
00:09:23.520 --> 00:09:27.740
This way it makes it easier to find what
we're using and what we need to use for

161
00:09:27.740 --> 00:09:28.720
our design.

162
00:09:28.720 --> 00:09:32.100
So, perfect question and
that's a very good idea.

163
00:09:32.100 --> 00:09:36.610
So, at this point, I've got my styles,
I've got my images, I've got my files and

164
00:09:36.610 --> 00:09:40.380
I've got my scripts and basically,
I've created the assets I need.

165
00:09:40.380 --> 00:09:44.500
The only thing I am missing
is the initial File

166
00:09:44.500 --> 00:09:49.080
that I need to use to create the website.

167
00:09:49.080 --> 00:09:53.050
And the initial file is going
to be an index file, okay?

168
00:09:53.050 --> 00:09:56.200
Now, you can have two file names,
index or default.

169
00:09:56.200 --> 00:10:00.543
A lot of Microsoft web pages
have a default .html or

170
00:10:00.543 --> 00:10:04.430
.htm file and
in Dreamweaver we default to index.

171
00:10:04.430 --> 00:10:05.970
That's the one we use most often.

172
00:10:05.970 --> 00:10:07.830
But either way, browsers will look for

173
00:10:07.830 --> 00:10:12.400
either default or
index as the root file on every website.

174
00:10:12.400 --> 00:10:18.030
Now when you go to google.com, you
don't have to type in google.com/index.

175
00:10:18.030 --> 00:10:19.820
It just automatically finds it.

176
00:10:19.820 --> 00:10:22.161
If you did type in for example, CNN.com or

177
00:10:22.161 --> 00:10:26.490
whatever, /index,
you would still surf to that page fine.

178
00:10:26.490 --> 00:10:27.110
Okay?

179
00:10:27.110 --> 00:10:29.310
And because they have that built in.

180
00:10:29.310 --> 00:10:34.273
>> Is that something that I commonly
see in those URLs, where you'll see

181
00:10:34.273 --> 00:10:40.060
index.aspx, or index.htm or
.html, or index.php?

182
00:10:40.060 --> 00:10:41.760
>> That's absolutely correct.

183
00:10:41.760 --> 00:10:46.140
So what happens with that is
the index file will determine

184
00:10:46.140 --> 00:10:50.590
what it is that you're going to look for
when you first get to a website.

185
00:10:50.590 --> 00:10:54.130
And it could be an ASPX file or
an ASP file,

186
00:10:54.130 --> 00:10:58.240
that just means hey this is a file
that resides on a Microsoft Server.

187
00:10:58.240 --> 00:11:01.970
Active Server Page, that's what it
stands for and the X stands for XML.

188
00:11:01.970 --> 00:11:05.880
But basically its saying, hey,
this is where it resides and

189
00:11:05.880 --> 00:11:07.430
that's what that information is.

190
00:11:07.430 --> 00:11:11.430
The PHP would be a data file and
again it's just saying,

191
00:11:11.430 --> 00:11:15.260
this resides on a SQL server somewhere,
or some kind of data server.

192
00:11:15.260 --> 00:11:16.360
So very good question, thank you.

193
00:11:17.550 --> 00:11:22.480
Okay, so to create the HTML file,
I'm going to go back to my application and

194
00:11:22.480 --> 00:11:26.840
I'm going to go to the file menu and
I'm going to go to new.

195
00:11:26.840 --> 00:11:31.550
Now, I could have right-clicked inside the
files panel and chosen new file as well.

196
00:11:31.550 --> 00:11:34.890
So either way would allow
me to get that file up.

197
00:11:34.890 --> 00:11:39.320
And as I get click happy here I'm creating
new folders when I didn't want them.

198
00:11:39.320 --> 00:11:43.270
So what I'm going to do here is I'm going
to right click again and choose new file.

199
00:11:44.370 --> 00:11:48.100
And what it does is it
automatically creates a html file.

200
00:11:48.100 --> 00:11:53.350
Now this html file designation is coming
from the fact that I have my preferences.

201
00:11:55.510 --> 00:12:00.150
Set up so that way it always
uses the HTML delimiter.

202
00:12:00.150 --> 00:12:03.740
You can set this up to be HTM,
it's totally up to you.

203
00:12:03.740 --> 00:12:07.600
Browsers look for HTM or
HTML, it doesn't matter, but

204
00:12:07.600 --> 00:12:11.530
I will show you where that is in
the preferences in a later episode.

205
00:12:11.530 --> 00:12:17.700
So I'm gonna type in index and you can see
right away index study html, I hit enter.

206
00:12:17.700 --> 00:12:22.690
And now, if i double-click on that file,
it opens up and I have some code, okay?

207
00:12:24.440 --> 00:12:27.890
My thought is at this point I'd like
to show you how to create it using

208
00:12:27.890 --> 00:12:29.650
the File-New feature.

209
00:12:29.650 --> 00:12:33.939
So I'm gonna close out of this, I'm gonna
go back to the File menu and choose New.

210
00:12:35.010 --> 00:12:38.010
Once I do that you're gonna
see many more options.

211
00:12:38.010 --> 00:12:40.930
So by default if I go
into the files panel and

212
00:12:40.930 --> 00:12:46.830
I create the file new within the files
panel, I will always get an HTML file.

213
00:12:46.830 --> 00:12:50.300
But if that's not the file type I need,
maybe I need a cascading style sheet or

214
00:12:50.300 --> 00:12:52.140
maybe I'm working with JavaScript or

215
00:12:52.140 --> 00:12:57.280
some other type of file I need to go to
File > New to specify which file type.

216
00:12:57.280 --> 00:12:59.620
By default, HTML is here at the top, so

217
00:12:59.620 --> 00:13:03.010
that's the one that is being
created inside the files panel.

218
00:13:03.010 --> 00:13:07.490
But if I click on CSS,
I can create a CSS file and

219
00:13:07.490 --> 00:13:09.490
I can specify what I wanna work with.

220
00:13:09.490 --> 00:13:13.500
If I want JavaScript, I click on this, and
it will, what happens is at this point,

221
00:13:13.500 --> 00:13:16.770
Dreamweaver understands the file
types that you're working with.

222
00:13:16.770 --> 00:13:19.880
And it will make sure that
the code coloring and

223
00:13:19.880 --> 00:13:23.680
the code information that it looks
at is specific to that type of file.

224
00:13:23.680 --> 00:13:24.560
Okay.

225
00:13:24.560 --> 00:13:27.450
I am going to create a html file again.

226
00:13:27.450 --> 00:13:29.720
We're just gonna choose a title here.

227
00:13:29.720 --> 00:13:32.190
And this time I'm gonna do for
example about, and

228
00:13:32.190 --> 00:13:37.850
I'm gonna type in us, and
HTML5 is the standard

229
00:13:37.850 --> 00:13:41.170
that we're using that is the current
ratified standard out in the internet.

230
00:13:41.170 --> 00:13:43.960
And you could choose
a different standard but

231
00:13:43.960 --> 00:13:47.280
I will tell you the most modern
designs are built with HTML5.

232
00:13:47.280 --> 00:13:51.920
It comes equipped with the ability to
do multimedia and it comes equipped

233
00:13:51.920 --> 00:13:54.479
to do the responsive designs like
everybody sees on the internet.

234
00:13:56.120 --> 00:13:58.580
We can connect to
an Cascading Style Sheets and

235
00:13:58.580 --> 00:14:02.640
we're talk about Cascading Style Sheets
in later episode and

236
00:14:02.640 --> 00:14:05.050
you can connect into that by
clicking on this link icon.

237
00:14:06.510 --> 00:14:10.370
And then at this point I'm
ready to click Create and

238
00:14:10.370 --> 00:14:13.290
now you'll see and
About Us here on the Title.

239
00:14:13.290 --> 00:14:17.000
Now it didn't technically
save file as about us

240
00:14:17.000 --> 00:14:19.900
Okay it's still called untitled one.

241
00:14:19.900 --> 00:14:23.980
And the fact that I have an asterisks
next to this untitled tab

242
00:14:23.980 --> 00:14:26.580
tells me that I haven't yet saved it.

243
00:14:26.580 --> 00:14:30.380
So if I do attempt to save this file
by going up to the file menu and

244
00:14:30.380 --> 00:14:31.600
choosing Save.

245
00:14:31.600 --> 00:14:33.870
It's gonna say,
hey you haven't save this yet,

246
00:14:33.870 --> 00:14:36.990
you haven't given me a name,
it's gonna ask you for a location.

247
00:14:36.990 --> 00:14:40.240
And I get to choose the name and
also the file type, and

248
00:14:40.240 --> 00:14:42.710
these are all the different
file types you can use.

249
00:14:42.710 --> 00:14:44.463
So I'm just gonna call this about us.

250
00:14:49.713 --> 00:14:51.870
As I have to learn how
to spell A-B-O-U-T us.

251
00:14:54.170 --> 00:14:55.800
There we go.

252
00:14:55.800 --> 00:14:57.710
Now, one more thing that
I wanna talk about, Wes,

253
00:14:57.710 --> 00:15:01.770
is the fact that I'm using
a specific naming convention.

254
00:15:01.770 --> 00:15:06.380
The naming convention I'm using is not
to include any spaces in the words that

255
00:15:06.380 --> 00:15:11.540
I'm typing, and it's also that I'm
not using any capital letters.

256
00:15:11.540 --> 00:15:15.730
You can use capital letters but
you shouldn't use spacing.

257
00:15:15.730 --> 00:15:19.800
In order to make up for the spacing, you
can use underscores in between each word

258
00:15:19.800 --> 00:15:22.140
and that will give you
some word separation.

259
00:15:22.140 --> 00:15:25.250
But you shouldn't use
spacing in between each word.

260
00:15:27.640 --> 00:15:29.120
Here's why.

261
00:15:29.120 --> 00:15:33.560
When you're surfing the internet,
browsers convert the spaces between

262
00:15:33.560 --> 00:15:37.398
the words of your files into %20s.

263
00:15:37.398 --> 00:15:42.380
%20 is the code used on the internet
to say that this is a space.

264
00:15:42.380 --> 00:15:45.400
It's basically I think your ASCII code,
and

265
00:15:45.400 --> 00:15:51.950
that is the American symbols for
Characters and it's version two.

266
00:15:51.950 --> 00:15:57.870
But the point is, is it converts
spaces into this percent, 20.

267
00:15:57.870 --> 00:16:00.940
And if you were to provide
somebody that URL,

268
00:16:00.940 --> 00:16:07.610
you would have to say
mywebsite.com/aboutpercent20us.html.

269
00:16:07.610 --> 00:16:10.450
And that would cause a lot of
confusion and you wouldn't want that.

270
00:16:10.450 --> 00:16:12.120
So, keep that in mind.

271
00:16:12.120 --> 00:16:14.700
Now it doesn't matter if you use spaces or
not.

272
00:16:14.700 --> 00:16:16.200
It doesn't matter if you use underscores.

273
00:16:16.200 --> 00:16:18.300
It doesn't matter if you
use capitol lettering.

274
00:16:18.300 --> 00:16:22.660
The only thing I recommend,
Is that you always be consistent.

275
00:16:22.660 --> 00:16:26.420
And so, your one site should
have the same consistency,

276
00:16:26.420 --> 00:16:29.302
and there's multiple purposes for
this consistency.

277
00:16:29.302 --> 00:16:31.000
The fact that you might be collaborating
with other people, the fact that you might

278
00:16:33.930 --> 00:16:37.200
come to this in the future, and want to
reference a file, just by typing it in.

279
00:16:37.200 --> 00:16:39.000
And you can't remember if you used caps,
or

280
00:16:39.000 --> 00:16:43.030
if you used underscore that kind of thing
that might cause problems in the future.

281
00:16:43.030 --> 00:16:46.930
So by remaining consistent you'll always
know well this is a file name for

282
00:16:46.930 --> 00:16:48.190
an HTML file.

283
00:16:48.190 --> 00:16:49.600
Therefore, it has no spaces and

284
00:16:49.600 --> 00:16:53.060
it's all lowercase, or whatever
the naming convention you've chosen.

285
00:16:53.060 --> 00:16:58.920
So, just be cognizant of the fact
that you need to remain consistent.

286
00:16:58.920 --> 00:16:59.850
Okay.

287
00:16:59.850 --> 00:17:03.170
So, with that said we
have our site configured.

288
00:17:03.170 --> 00:17:08.180
We have a couple of HTML files ready
to go and we are now ready to move on

289
00:17:08.180 --> 00:17:12.090
to a new topic where we're gonna
be working to create our pages.

290
00:17:12.090 --> 00:17:13.050
>> All right, very good.

291
00:17:13.050 --> 00:17:15.760
Well, Jim, thank you for that information.

292
00:17:15.760 --> 00:17:19.630
Do you have anything else that you'd
like to talk about with creating sites?

293
00:17:21.330 --> 00:17:23.240
>> That's a good question, Wes.

294
00:17:23.240 --> 00:17:24.900
When it comes to working with sites,

295
00:17:24.900 --> 00:17:28.500
it's always best to let
Dreamweaver do the work for you.

296
00:17:28.500 --> 00:17:32.110
These applications are wonderful, they're
put together by a lot of great developers.

297
00:17:32.110 --> 00:17:35.360
And they try to make it as
intuitive as possible, and

298
00:17:35.360 --> 00:17:39.690
if you let the application do the work for
you, you won't have to stress later on.

299
00:17:39.690 --> 00:17:43.230
What you're gonna see when we start
delving a little deeper into creating

300
00:17:43.230 --> 00:17:49.330
these webpages is the fact that
DreamWeaver will write all of the code.

301
00:17:49.330 --> 00:17:53.580
So even though I'm showing you the code on
the screen and you're seeing it, you won't

302
00:17:53.580 --> 00:17:58.180
necessarily have to always be in the code,
and you definitely won't have to write it.

303
00:17:58.180 --> 00:18:00.090
Especially if you let
DreamWeaver take control.

304
00:18:00.090 --> 00:18:02.980
>> Well Jim, we appreciate having you
here, we appreciate that information, we

305
00:18:02.980 --> 00:18:06.620
appreciate you the viewer, but we're gonna
go ahead and sign out here at ITProTV.

306
00:18:06.620 --> 00:18:07.840
I've been your host, Wes Bryan.

307
00:18:07.840 --> 00:18:09.250
>> And I'm Jim Sorrells.

308
00:18:09.250 --> 00:18:11.717
>> And we'll see you next time.

309
00:18:11.717 --> 00:18:19.559
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim show the viewer how to create a new page. They discuss HTML characteristics such as tags, elements, attributes and values. They explain HTML structure such as the header, body and doctype. They explore using HTLM5 structure such as headers, navs, mains, sections, articles and footers.
episodes.title: Creating a Page in Dreamweaver
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:11.934 --> 00:00:15.919
Welcome back to another exciting episode
here at ITProTV, I'm your host Wes Bryan.

3
00:00:15.919 --> 00:00:20.091
And in today's episode we're coming
back at you with more DreamWeaver.

4
00:00:20.091 --> 00:00:24.450
That's right, we are continuing
along in our Creative Cloud 2015.

5
00:00:24.450 --> 00:00:27.900
Joining me back in the studios today
is none other than Mr. Jim Searles.

6
00:00:27.900 --> 00:00:29.390
Jim, how are you doing today, sir?

7
00:00:29.390 --> 00:00:33.700
>> I'm doing great Wes, thanks for having
me back and thank you to the ITProTV team

8
00:00:33.700 --> 00:00:36.290
for welcoming me back to
talk about Dreamweaver.

9
00:00:36.290 --> 00:00:39.050
And in this episode we're gonna
talk about creating a page

10
00:00:39.050 --> 00:00:41.460
within the Dreamweaver application.

11
00:00:41.460 --> 00:00:44.990
And in the last episode,
we talked about creating a site.

12
00:00:44.990 --> 00:00:49.200
And I did create an index.html file, and
what I'd like to do now is show you and

13
00:00:49.200 --> 00:00:52.430
talk about the semantics and
the structure behind that.

14
00:00:52.430 --> 00:00:55.090
So, what I like to do is go
back to the application and

15
00:00:55.090 --> 00:00:56.870
go to the bottom right hand corner.

16
00:00:56.870 --> 00:01:02.060
And inside the Files panel,
I'm going to click on the index.html.

17
00:01:02.060 --> 00:01:05.410
So, I'm gonna double-click here and
open that up.

18
00:01:05.410 --> 00:01:08.840
So, what you're gonna see here
is in the document workspace,

19
00:01:08.840 --> 00:01:11.250
this area out here to the left, okay.

20
00:01:11.250 --> 00:01:15.760
What you're seeing is basically is
the design view of this application.

21
00:01:15.760 --> 00:01:19.030
So, I've opened the index.html,
but there's nothing here.

22
00:01:19.030 --> 00:01:20.860
So it's completely blank.

23
00:01:20.860 --> 00:01:23.480
And what that means is
it's a blank canvas.

24
00:01:23.480 --> 00:01:25.600
It's waiting for you to do something.

25
00:01:25.600 --> 00:01:30.610
However, in previous episodes you may
have seen that code view was selected, so

26
00:01:30.610 --> 00:01:33.970
in the code view you can see there's
a lot going on inside the code.

27
00:01:33.970 --> 00:01:37.200
So, how is it that if there's
a lot going on in the code,

28
00:01:37.200 --> 00:01:39.680
there's really nothing in the design.

29
00:01:39.680 --> 00:01:43.720
That's because technically when you create
a page within Dreamweaver, it says,

30
00:01:43.720 --> 00:01:48.700
hey, I know what's coming but I don't
know the content you are gonna work with.

31
00:01:48.700 --> 00:01:52.210
So what it does is,
it creates the structure that you need but

32
00:01:52.210 --> 00:01:55.800
it leaves everything the blank canvas for
you to work on.

33
00:01:55.800 --> 00:01:59.970
So I'd like to talk about that structure
behind the scenes, just so you understand.

34
00:01:59.970 --> 00:02:03.990
It's important to know that Dreamweaver
lets you work in an environment that is

35
00:02:03.990 --> 00:02:07.170
almost free of having to write code.

36
00:02:07.170 --> 00:02:10.980
But it's always a good idea to understand
what's going on in the code so

37
00:02:10.980 --> 00:02:13.190
this way you can build your pages and

38
00:02:13.190 --> 00:02:17.650
correct mistakes that might happen
based on what Dreamweaver's doing.

39
00:02:17.650 --> 00:02:21.460
Or not doing that you want it to do,
and that's gonna be important.

40
00:02:21.460 --> 00:02:23.450
So I'm gonna start here in
the code view for a moment.

41
00:02:23.450 --> 00:02:27.440
So, I'm gonna click on this
code button and toggle that on.

42
00:02:27.440 --> 00:02:29.830
So, when we look at the code,

43
00:02:29.830 --> 00:02:34.160
you first see here out to the left
that there are all these numbers.

44
00:02:34.160 --> 00:02:40.130
So the code that's written in HTML, hyper
text markup language is linear based,

45
00:02:40.130 --> 00:02:43.520
means it starts at line one and
works it's way down to the bottom.

46
00:02:43.520 --> 00:02:45.355
Okay It's very linear.

47
00:02:45.355 --> 00:02:48.879
There's other programming languages
that are known as object-oriented, and

48
00:02:48.879 --> 00:02:51.525
object-oriented allows you to write

49
00:02:51.525 --> 00:02:55.115
modular code sections that
can be called up at any time.

50
00:02:55.115 --> 00:02:58.600
So it's not necessarily going to
execute it from top to bottom.

51
00:02:58.600 --> 00:03:01.660
We'll talk more about that when
we get to cascading style sheets.

52
00:03:01.660 --> 00:03:06.680
But the point here is, is I can see by
the numbers that the doc type here HTML

53
00:03:06.680 --> 00:03:08.920
is the first item on the line.

54
00:03:08.920 --> 00:03:12.045
And what you're seeing here,
as well as that Dreamweaver

55
00:03:12.045 --> 00:03:16.085
is providing a color code to let
you determine what's going on.

56
00:03:16.085 --> 00:03:19.085
So, when I look at this aqua or
this teal color,

57
00:03:19.085 --> 00:03:22.923
this is telling me the element
that I am working with, okay.

58
00:03:22.923 --> 00:03:27.887
So basically doc type is
the HTML5 element that declares to

59
00:03:27.887 --> 00:03:32.042
the browser what type
of code you're using.

60
00:03:32.042 --> 00:03:35.850
So the browser sees this and
says, it's HTML5.

61
00:03:35.850 --> 00:03:41.030
Now if you ever wanted to
configure a HTML 4.01 or

62
00:03:41.030 --> 00:03:47.230
as XHTML transitional file you would
see that this doc type is a huge mess.

63
00:03:47.230 --> 00:03:52.670
Luckily for us HTML5 has been simplified
and this line is now really done well.

64
00:03:52.670 --> 00:03:58.480
So this element includes this less
than and greater than sign, okay.

65
00:03:58.480 --> 00:04:04.930
So that includes or encompasses
the entire element of code that we need.

66
00:04:04.930 --> 00:04:07.300
The fact here that it
says that this is HTML,

67
00:04:07.300 --> 00:04:10.260
again identifies the type of
document you are working with.

68
00:04:10.260 --> 00:04:14.857
So !doctype html declares HTML5.

69
00:04:14.857 --> 00:04:20.550
Everything else below that is
basically a container for the webpage.

70
00:04:20.550 --> 00:04:23.480
So when I look at this HTML tag on line 2,

71
00:04:23.480 --> 00:04:27.620
I see that there's
a matching tag on line 10.

72
00:04:27.620 --> 00:04:30.170
And the matching tag is
a little bit different for

73
00:04:30.170 --> 00:04:33.520
the closing tag, but
it's very much the same.

74
00:04:33.520 --> 00:04:36.110
So it starts with the less
than sign here on line two.

75
00:04:36.110 --> 00:04:40.380
And greater than sign and
the HTML element is in between, okay?

76
00:04:40.380 --> 00:04:44.950
However, when you close it off,
you do a less than sign, slash and

77
00:04:44.950 --> 00:04:46.680
then HTML, greater than.

78
00:04:46.680 --> 00:04:50.470
Now, again,
Dreamweaver knows the rules for this code.

79
00:04:50.470 --> 00:04:54.460
So because of that It is
automatically doing it for you.

80
00:04:54.460 --> 00:04:57.320
Now this HTML container says,

81
00:04:57.320 --> 00:05:00.430
everything that follows is going
to be part of the webpage.

82
00:05:00.430 --> 00:05:02.850
So it says this is the container for
everything.

83
00:05:04.620 --> 00:05:10.180
Now, we go to line three and we see
that we have this head element, okay.

84
00:05:10.180 --> 00:05:15.320
The head element is the header
portion of your webpage.

85
00:05:15.320 --> 00:05:19.760
So I start here on line three, and
in this case I end on line six.

86
00:05:19.760 --> 00:05:23.810
So again, the opening has the less
than sign, head, greater than, but

87
00:05:23.810 --> 00:05:27.330
the closing has less than sign,
slash, greater than.

88
00:05:27.330 --> 00:05:28.400
So what that means is,

89
00:05:28.400 --> 00:05:32.730
everything in between that is going to

HTML 5, okay?

314
00:18:11.220 --> 00:18:14.180
Now there's a couple of other
ones that I'd like to talk about,

315
00:18:14.180 --> 00:18:16.740
there's the main content section,
which I had mentioned, and

316
00:18:16.740 --> 00:18:20.730
then you have an aside and
you have an article and a section.

317
00:18:20.730 --> 00:18:25.300
Now, an aside is basically,
if you ever went to a blog site, and

318
00:18:25.300 --> 00:18:28.470
you have all the archives of blogs
that are there, with the dates.

319
00:18:28.470 --> 00:18:29.920
That's where the aside goes.

320
00:18:29.920 --> 00:18:32.490
So it goes to the left or
to the right of the page, and

321
00:18:32.490 --> 00:18:34.940
it specifies certain information,

322
00:18:34.940 --> 00:18:40.050
whereas an article is literally where the
main writeup of your information might go.

323
00:18:40.050 --> 00:18:42.590
So you're gonna use the article tag for
that.

324
00:18:42.590 --> 00:18:47.230
And then a section, you can create
sections within your divisions in order

325
00:18:47.230 --> 00:18:51.870
to be able to section off your content and
decide how that layout's going to be.

326
00:18:51.870 --> 00:18:54.240
So at this point, I've got my content for

327
00:18:54.240 --> 00:18:58.370
ID wrapper goes here, and it's in black,
which means it's selected.

328
00:18:58.370 --> 00:19:02.580
If I click at the end, then my purse
is down at the end of that information.

329
00:19:02.580 --> 00:19:06.570
So what I'd like to do is insert
the header at the top of that so

330
00:19:06.570 --> 00:19:08.520
I really don't want this text.

331
00:19:08.520 --> 00:19:12.420
I'm gonna select the text and I'm gonna
hit the Delete key on the keyboard or

332
00:19:12.420 --> 00:19:15.745
Backspace so the text is gone but
the division remains.

333
00:19:17.060 --> 00:19:22.470
Now I'm gonna click on the header, and
I get the same dialog box that I did for

334
00:19:22.470 --> 00:19:27.280
division which is good because now
it says, insert at insertion point.

335
00:19:27.280 --> 00:19:29.830
It knows that in the design
I've placed my cursor and

336
00:19:29.830 --> 00:19:31.860
I had a flashing cursor
inside that division.

337
00:19:31.860 --> 00:19:33.770
And it's gonna insert right at that spot.

338
00:19:33.770 --> 00:19:35.040
And that's what I want.

339
00:19:35.040 --> 00:19:37.610
I want to have the header
section right there.

340
00:19:37.610 --> 00:19:41.930
Now, because it's already called header,
I don't necessarily need an ID or a class.

341
00:19:41.930 --> 00:19:45.240
If I'm going to style this later on, yeah,
that might be a good idea to name it, or

342
00:19:45.240 --> 00:19:47.760
to give it a class or an ID, and
we'll talk a little more about that later.

343
00:19:47.760 --> 00:19:49.060
Again, I apologize.

344
00:19:49.060 --> 00:19:52.490
But I'm just gonna click OK because
I already know it's the header and

345
00:19:52.490 --> 00:19:54.930
I can style the header
based on the name header.

346
00:19:54.930 --> 00:19:56.600
We'll talk more about that as well.

347
00:19:56.600 --> 00:19:57.900
Let me click OK.

348
00:19:57.900 --> 00:20:01.510
So at this point it says, content for
new header tag goes here.

349
00:20:01.510 --> 00:20:05.860
Now here's what interesting, it looks like
its in the same spot as that division.

350
00:20:05.860 --> 00:20:09.890
So it looks like I
didn't add anything new.

351
00:20:09.890 --> 00:20:12.400
But again if I go look
in the code view window.

352
00:20:12.400 --> 00:20:15.790
You'll see I still have my division,
my div tag.

353
00:20:15.790 --> 00:20:18.060
I have the wrapper, and
then headers right inside of that.

354
00:20:18.060 --> 00:20:21.910
So this header element is right
inside of the division container.

355
00:20:21.910 --> 00:20:24.890
As a matter of fact,
Dreamweaver has indented the code

356
00:20:24.890 --> 00:20:29.260
to tell you that this resides
inside of the div element.

357
00:20:29.260 --> 00:20:30.380
Literally does it for you.

358
00:20:31.430 --> 00:20:33.830
Okay, so wanna go back to design.

359
00:20:33.830 --> 00:20:37.040
Now, in this example,
I would like to have the next item.

360
00:20:37.040 --> 00:20:38.950
Cuz we usually have a header at the top,

361
00:20:38.950 --> 00:20:41.840
then we have a navigation
system right below it, right?

362
00:20:41.840 --> 00:20:48.280
So, I'd like the next tag to go after
the end of the header, for example.

363
00:20:48.280 --> 00:20:51.880
I don't want,
the navigation to be inside that,

364
00:20:51.880 --> 00:20:55.320
or I'd like it to be right after that,
so that's a very good point.

365
00:20:55.320 --> 00:20:57.800
So I'm gonna come over here,
and click on my Navigation.

366
00:20:57.800 --> 00:21:02.190
It's gonna say at insertion point, but
again I can click the pull down here, and

367
00:21:02.190 --> 00:21:07.070
I can say, before the tag, after the start
of a tag, before the end of the tag or

368
00:21:07.070 --> 00:21:08.280
after a tag.

369
00:21:08.280 --> 00:21:12.170
Well if I choose after a tag,
for example here, it's gonna say,

370
00:21:12.170 --> 00:21:13.569
do you want it after the division?

371
00:21:14.590 --> 00:21:16.350
And in this case it's gonna
put it after the division.

372
00:21:16.350 --> 00:21:16.890
So you know what?

373
00:21:16.890 --> 00:21:19.510
I'm gonna choose before end of division

374
00:21:19.510 --> 00:21:22.120
which means it's gonna put
it right after the header.

375
00:21:22.120 --> 00:21:23.430
So I'm gonna come over here.

376
00:21:23.430 --> 00:21:25.610
And I'm gonna choose
the Before End of tag.

377
00:21:25.610 --> 00:21:27.850
And hopefully it gives
me the division option.

378
00:21:27.850 --> 00:21:28.400
Which it does.

379
00:21:28.400 --> 00:21:29.190
So I click on that.

380
00:21:29.190 --> 00:21:35.040
And now that means I'm gonna have header
first then I'm going to have second and

381
00:21:35.040 --> 00:21:38.260
then their both gonna be inside
of the division for the wrapper.

382
00:21:38.260 --> 00:21:42.560
So I click OK and
now you can see it's laid out in this way.

383
00:21:42.560 --> 00:21:46.280
The header at the top then below
it if I look at the code view

384
00:21:46.280 --> 00:21:48.070
there both inside of the.

385
00:21:48.070 --> 00:21:53.130
Okay so we're going to keep building
the next section usually we have,

386
00:21:53.130 --> 00:21:56.780
after the navigation, is we usually
put the main content section.

387
00:21:56.780 --> 00:21:59.550
So I'm just gonna do a main for
this point in time, and,

388
00:21:59.550 --> 00:22:03.020
again, just clicking on these
icons inside the insert panel

389
00:22:03.020 --> 00:22:07.040
makes it very easy to build your layout,
without even having to think about it.

390
00:22:07.040 --> 00:22:08.710
So, I'm gonna click on this item.

391
00:22:08.710 --> 00:22:10.440
It's gonna say wrap around the selection.

392
00:22:10.440 --> 00:22:11.510
I had text selected.

393
00:22:11.510 --> 00:22:12.650
So that is what it's saying.

394
00:22:12.650 --> 00:22:13.500
I don't wanna do that.

395
00:22:13.500 --> 00:22:18.900
Remember, I wanna go after they are, I am
sorry, before the end of the division.

396
00:22:18.900 --> 00:22:20.990
So, when I say, before end of tag and

397
00:22:20.990 --> 00:22:26.240
I'm gonna choose the div wrapper and
now this should be the third item.

398
00:22:26.240 --> 00:22:29.710
So, now, I'm gonna have a stack,
header, nav and then main.

399
00:22:29.710 --> 00:22:30.670
Okay.

400
00:22:30.670 --> 00:22:33.310
So, next thing I'd like to do,
just for this example, so for

401
00:22:33.310 --> 00:22:36.050
our conversation, is to add the footer.

402
00:22:36.050 --> 00:22:39.890
So, to add the footer, I'm gonna go
over here and click on my footer item.

403
00:22:39.890 --> 00:22:41.560
Again, the text was selected so

404
00:22:41.560 --> 00:22:43.920
it's automatically choosing
wrap around selection.

405
00:22:43.920 --> 00:22:47.260
I'm going to click the pull-down,
choose before the end of tag.

406
00:22:47.260 --> 00:22:51.800
And lastly I'm going to choose that I
need to use the division ID wrapper and

407
00:22:51.800 --> 00:22:52.890
put it before that.

408
00:22:52.890 --> 00:22:54.100
I click OK.

409
00:22:54.100 --> 00:22:58.020
And now I've got my stack of four
items that I can start designing and

410
00:22:58.020 --> 00:23:00.140
working with, and I've got the layout.

411
00:23:00.140 --> 00:23:03.550
So the basic configuration of header,
nav, main, and

412
00:23:03.550 --> 00:23:06.890
footer is how all web pages are designed.

413
00:23:06.890 --> 00:23:07.950
Design, believe it or not.

414
00:23:07.950 --> 00:23:10.240
That's like the secret sauce.

415
00:23:10.240 --> 00:23:13.860
You look at these web pages and
you see a lot of content going on.

416
00:23:13.860 --> 00:23:18.480
But typically, all it is, is the branding
at the top, you've got some form of

417
00:23:18.480 --> 00:23:21.460
navigation that people can click on,
you've got the main content.

418
00:23:21.460 --> 00:23:24.210
Now, the main content, you might have
to scroll down to see everything and

419
00:23:24.210 --> 00:23:26.000
it might have a lot of
information in there.

420
00:23:26.000 --> 00:23:27.670
But once you get to the bottom,

421
00:23:27.670 --> 00:23:31.180
you'll always see the footer
that shows the copyright, or

422
00:23:31.180 --> 00:23:37.340
they might have a site map, or they might
provide you with a lot more information.

423
00:23:37.340 --> 00:23:39.050
So there's a lot going on there.

424
00:23:39.050 --> 00:23:44.220
So that's the basic structure for
any website that you're working with.

425
00:23:44.220 --> 00:23:48.020
And at this point, I'm ready to save this.

426
00:23:48.020 --> 00:23:52.253
So I'm gonna just do a Ctrl+S on the PC or
Cmd+S on the Mac and

427
00:23:52.253 --> 00:23:57.817
you're gonna see that asterisk goes
away and I've just saved the file, okay?

428
00:23:57.817 --> 00:23:59.806
>> Jim, before we started the episode,

429
00:23:59.806 --> 00:24:03.113
one of the things we were talking
about is looking at a website.

430
00:24:03.113 --> 00:24:07.232
Now, when I navigate to a site I
could see sometimes, you know,

431
00:24:07.232 --> 00:24:09.650
it's almost intuitive, right?

432
00:24:09.650 --> 00:24:10.820
Use of the About Us, right?

433
00:24:10.820 --> 00:24:13.200
If I click on About Us,
where is gonna take me?

434
00:24:13.200 --> 00:24:17.426
Well, I'm hoping it's gonna open a page
that says About Us, and maybe some topics.

435
00:24:17.426 --> 00:24:20.330
Maybe it's a pira, not piracy,
how about privacy, right?

436
00:24:20.330 --> 00:24:24.539
We have a privacy concern, you click on
that, it gives you a privacy statement and

437
00:24:24.539 --> 00:24:26.682
contact us, all of those common things.

438
00:24:26.682 --> 00:24:30.452
Now, that's based on navigation and
sometimes it's intuitive and

439
00:24:30.452 --> 00:24:34.423
it's the other times I click on a site and
I have no clue where it takes me.

440
00:24:34.423 --> 00:24:39.337
So when we're setting up a web site,
is that something we have to take into

441
00:24:39.337 --> 00:24:44.050
consideration, how an end user is
gonna navigate through that site?

442
00:24:44.050 --> 00:24:47.050
>> Absolutely, that is a huge,
huge consideration.

443
00:24:47.050 --> 00:24:51.390
Whenever you build a web page, it's always
important that you understand the user

444
00:24:51.390 --> 00:24:54.605
interface and how users are going
to interact with that page.

445
00:24:54.605 --> 00:24:58.795
So there's some guidelines that we
would use for navigation specifically.

446
00:24:58.795 --> 00:25:01.925
For example,
you wouldn't wanna have more than seven

447
00:25:01.925 --> 00:25:06.080
navigable items across the top for
people to find and click on.

448
00:25:06.080 --> 00:25:11.185
The other aspect to this is, you want no
more than two words in that navigation.

449
00:25:11.185 --> 00:25:14.345
So for example, you said About Us,
that's just two words.

450
00:25:14.345 --> 00:25:17.445
Or you might have Careers, or you might
have News, or you might have Home or

451
00:25:17.445 --> 00:25:18.480
something like that.

452
00:25:18.480 --> 00:25:22.460
But you wouldn't want to have an entire
sentence that somebody has to click on for

453
00:25:22.460 --> 00:25:23.060
navigation.

454
00:25:23.060 --> 00:25:23.900
That just wouldn't work.

455
00:25:23.900 --> 00:25:28.080
So you want to minimize clutter
up in your navigation, and

456
00:25:28.080 --> 00:25:29.560
it needs to be as clean as possible.

457
00:25:29.560 --> 00:25:32.950
You mentioned getting lost, that's
important, if you don't have a lot of

458
00:25:32.950 --> 00:25:35.980
clutter, you're gonna make it so that
way people can find what they need and

459
00:25:35.980 --> 00:25:38.150
they can navigate to
where they need to go to.

460
00:25:38.150 --> 00:25:40.920
So these are really important
considerations when it comes to

461
00:25:42.540 --> 00:25:44.490
working with navigation.

462
00:25:44.490 --> 00:25:48.030
You also want to avoid long drop downs.

463
00:25:48.030 --> 00:25:49.210
That's incredibly important,

464
00:25:49.210 --> 00:25:53.100
because if somebody has to look through
a list when they grab the pull down

465
00:25:53.100 --> 00:25:56.610
to find what they're looking for, again,
you're not making it user friendly.

466
00:25:56.610 --> 00:25:59.660
And the other one is you want
some kind of call to action

467
00:25:59.660 --> 00:26:03.510
to direct users to important
information on your page.

468
00:26:03.510 --> 00:26:07.760
So those are some things that you might
wanna include in your navigation, and

469
00:26:07.760 --> 00:26:12.430
those are some things that will make your
site very, very user friendly and useable.

470
00:26:12.430 --> 00:26:13.620
>> That's all great information.

471
00:26:13.620 --> 00:26:16.930
I'll tell you what, if it can make
somebody like me, who can go click happy,

472
00:26:16.930 --> 00:26:20.820
little bit easier to navigate
through the website.

473
00:26:20.820 --> 00:26:24.900
At the same time, I kind of know where I'm
going ahead of time, that's always good.

474
00:26:24.900 --> 00:26:27.380
Well Jim, thank you for
all that information.

475
00:26:27.380 --> 00:26:29.640
I know that we're coming to
the end of this episode, but

476
00:26:29.640 --> 00:26:33.040
before we take the time to sign out,
do you have any additional information?

477
00:26:33.040 --> 00:26:34.340
>> Yeah, thanks, Wes.

478
00:26:34.340 --> 00:26:35.910
I do have some additional information.

479
00:26:35.910 --> 00:26:37.620
I'd like to take a look at our code here,

480
00:26:37.620 --> 00:26:40.350
just one last glance at
it before we finish up.

481
00:26:40.350 --> 00:26:44.050
And so I'm gonna click on code view and
I just wanna show you again how we've laid

482
00:26:44.050 --> 00:26:48.910
out that information, and
how it's all inside of the div wrapper.

483
00:26:48.910 --> 00:26:51.620
And so basically,
you can see what that looks like.

484
00:26:51.620 --> 00:26:54.490
And it's all contained,
it's indented by Dreamweaver, so

485
00:26:54.490 --> 00:26:56.150
that way you can see where it's going.

486
00:26:56.150 --> 00:27:00.093
And I'd like to also show you what this is
gonna look like if I were to go to, for

487
00:27:00.093 --> 00:27:01.135
example live view.

488
00:27:01.135 --> 00:27:05.163
So if I go back to design here, you can
see the dashed lines around everything, so

489
00:27:05.163 --> 00:27:08.150
if I click the pulldown here,
and choose Live view, okay.

490
00:27:08.150 --> 00:27:11.110
Basically it's just showing
me the text that's there.

491
00:27:11.110 --> 00:27:15.130
So it's up to us at this point to
replace this text with our content.

492
00:27:15.130 --> 00:27:18.890
And to start working with that,
so technically you're not seeing

493
00:27:18.890 --> 00:27:22.220
the dashed lines for
the divisions that we've created.

494
00:27:22.220 --> 00:27:26.150
And it's up to us to start using
cascading style sheets to style these

495
00:27:26.150 --> 00:27:30.780
content sections so they make more sense
than just what you see here in this page.

496
00:27:30.780 --> 00:27:33.260
>> Well Jim, we do appreciate your
knowledge on the subject there.

497
00:27:33.260 --> 00:27:35.150
And we do appreciate you,
the viewer, for watching.

498
00:27:35.150 --> 00:27:39.170
We're gonna go ahead here and sign out at
ITProTV, I've been your host, Wes Bryan.

499
00:27:39.170 --> 00:27:40.070
>> And I'm Jim Sorrells.

500
00:27:40.070 --> 00:27:40.690
>> And we'll see you next time.

501
00:27:40.690 --> 00:27:50.300
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim discuss styling with Cascading Style Sheets. They talk about the three different styles including internal/embedded, external and inline. They introduce selectors such as classes, IDs and tags and well as the CSS Designer panel.
episodes.title: Styling with CSS
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:11.672 --> 00:00:14.819
Welcome back to another exciting
episode here at ITProTV.

3
00:00:14.819 --> 00:00:17.554
I'm your host, Wes Bryan,
and in today's episode,

4
00:00:17.554 --> 00:00:20.061
we're coming back at you
with more DreamWeaver.

5
00:00:20.061 --> 00:00:22.480
That's right, the Creative Cloud 2015,

6
00:00:22.480 --> 00:00:26.410
and we're gonna be looking
at styling with CSS.

7
00:00:26.410 --> 00:00:28.975
I know what you're thinking, that's right,
we're gonna hit you with an acronym right

8
00:00:28.975 --> 00:00:32.935
up front, but joining me in the studios
today to help lend his expertise and

9
00:00:32.935 --> 00:00:35.765
define what CSS means is none
other than Mr. Jim Searles.

10
00:00:35.765 --> 00:00:36.895
Jim, how're you doing, sir?

11
00:00:36.895 --> 00:00:37.875
>> I'm doing great, Wes.

12
00:00:37.875 --> 00:00:42.165
Again, thank you for having me here today,
and thank you to the ITProTV team for

13
00:00:42.165 --> 00:00:45.095
allowing me to talk about DreamWeaver,
and specifically today,

14
00:00:45.095 --> 00:00:50.245
to talk about these styles within
DreamWeaver and cascading style sheets.

15
00:00:50.245 --> 00:00:53.500
So yes, CSS stands for
cascading style sheets.

16
00:00:53.500 --> 00:00:56.620
And basically what cascading
styles sheets allows you to do

17
00:00:56.620 --> 00:01:01.620
is it allows you to determine
a hierarchy for your styles.

18
00:01:01.620 --> 00:01:05.290
And the first thing I'd like to talk
about is the fact that you have

19
00:01:05.290 --> 00:01:07.690
three different type of style sheets.

20
00:01:07.690 --> 00:01:09.620
So you might have external style sheets,

21
00:01:09.620 --> 00:01:12.880
where you point to a file that
contains a list of all your styles.

22
00:01:12.880 --> 00:01:15.570
And this is how people share information,
you can actually share

23
00:01:15.570 --> 00:01:19.540
styles that you've used in the past from
different websites that you've created and

24
00:01:19.540 --> 00:01:21.130
then just keep reusing them.

25
00:01:21.130 --> 00:01:23.280
So external style sheets
are very useful for that.

26
00:01:23.280 --> 00:01:26.460
Also, they're very useful for
applying to multiple

27
00:01:26.460 --> 00:01:30.440
pages within your site because you can
have one source of all your styles and

28
00:01:30.440 --> 00:01:33.160
all your pages access
from that one source.

29
00:01:33.160 --> 00:01:36.260
The second type of style
sheet is embedded styles.

30
00:01:36.260 --> 00:01:41.040
Embedded styles are embedded in
the header section of your documents.

31
00:01:41.040 --> 00:01:46.020
So in a previous episode, we talked about
the head section in our HTML code and

32
00:01:46.020 --> 00:01:48.410
how that passes the information
on to the browser.

33
00:01:48.410 --> 00:01:53.246
Well, in this case, the information that's
passing is how to stylize the webpage and

34
00:01:53.246 --> 00:01:55.360
what content is gonna look like.

35
00:01:55.360 --> 00:01:57.010
So, that is embedded.

36
00:01:57.010 --> 00:02:00.150
It's embedded in a style
tag in the header section.

37
00:02:00.150 --> 00:02:05.450
And then the third style sheet that
you can have is the inline style.

38
00:02:05.450 --> 00:02:10.330
Now, you might think, okay,
there are three levels of styles,

39
00:02:10.330 --> 00:02:13.180
and one has to take
precedent over another.

40
00:02:13.180 --> 00:02:15.250
And that's absolutely correct.

41
00:02:15.250 --> 00:02:19.670
The style that is closest to
the object that you're defining

42
00:02:19.670 --> 00:02:21.640
has the highest precedence.

43
00:02:21.640 --> 00:02:26.170
That means, for example, the inline
style that is right inside of the tag or

44
00:02:26.170 --> 00:02:29.850
the element that you're working with
is gonna have the highest precedence.

45
00:02:29.850 --> 00:02:33.640
Then the next style that has the next
level of precedence is the embedded style.

46
00:02:33.640 --> 00:02:39.270
Because it's also inside the same
page of that website you're creating.

47
00:02:39.270 --> 00:02:45.240
And then the last precedence or order of
precedence is the external style sheet.

48
00:02:45.240 --> 00:02:48.870
However there's also an order of
precedence within the styles themselves.

49
00:02:48.870 --> 00:02:52.400
So as you start listing in your embedded,
you're gonna have a list of styles,

50
00:02:52.400 --> 00:02:56.390
which ever one comes at the top
is further away from the code, or

51
00:02:56.390 --> 00:02:58.150
further away from the objects
you're working with.

52
00:02:58.150 --> 00:03:01.022
Therefore, they might be overwritten
by other styles within that list.

53
00:03:01.022 --> 00:03:02.800
And same thing with your external styles,
right?

54
00:03:02.800 --> 00:03:07.252
You're gonna have hundreds or thousands of
styles in that external style sheet and

55
00:03:07.252 --> 00:03:10.510
the order in which they're
listed makes a difference.

56
00:03:10.510 --> 00:03:11.590
So we gotta keep that in mind.

57
00:03:11.590 --> 00:03:13.760
But that's why they're called the cascade.

58
00:03:13.760 --> 00:03:16.310
So one style can inherit
from other styles, and

59
00:03:16.310 --> 00:03:19.250
then you can change them
up as you go down the list.

60
00:03:19.250 --> 00:03:23.970
And that new style that you've defined
in that list that has come further along

61
00:03:23.970 --> 00:03:27.170
has the highest precedence because it's
closer to the object that you're trying to

62
00:03:27.170 --> 00:03:28.490
stylize.

63
00:03:28.490 --> 00:03:32.500
So, cascading style sheets,
three types of style sheets,

64
00:03:32.500 --> 00:03:36.500
we've got external, embedded, and inline.

65
00:03:36.500 --> 00:03:41.150
Well, in a previous episode, we also
talked about the fact that when we created

66
00:03:41.150 --> 00:03:46.600
our divisions, the header, nav,
footer, for example, we could assign

67
00:03:46.600 --> 00:03:51.850
ID selectors or class selectors.

68
00:03:51.850 --> 00:03:56.840
And I said as a matter of fact,
that we didn't have to include the header,

69
00:03:56.840 --> 00:04:03.330
did not need to have a class or a ID
because we could stylize the tag itself.

70
00:04:03.330 --> 00:04:05.340
So even within cascading style sheets,

71
00:04:05.340 --> 00:04:10.410
there are three type of selectors that
allow you to create these styles.

72
00:04:10.410 --> 00:04:12.580
Now let me explain what those are.

73
00:04:12.580 --> 00:04:17.160
When we talk about the tag, we talk about
the HTML tags that are available to you,

74
00:04:17.160 --> 00:04:20.290
and there are about 50 to about 75 tags.

75
00:04:20.290 --> 00:04:23.300
And HTML is one of them,
body is another, header is another.

76
00:04:23.300 --> 00:04:27.410
Head, nav, or navigation,
sorry, footer is another.

77
00:04:27.410 --> 00:04:31.890
So all of these tags that we've
used in previous episodes

78
00:04:31.890 --> 00:04:36.030
are called HTML tags, and
those are available for us to style.

79
00:04:36.030 --> 00:04:38.020
We can apply a style to that tag.

80
00:04:38.020 --> 00:04:41.580
We can actually call it, we can say,
hey, apply all these styles to the body.

81
00:04:41.580 --> 00:04:44.830
So if I wanted to, I could apply a style
to the body that changes the background

82
00:04:44.830 --> 00:04:48.050
to black, for example, and that'll work.

83
00:04:48.050 --> 00:04:51.330
But then, you have the class style.

84
00:04:51.330 --> 00:04:54.840
The class style is applied to
objects that might repeat or

85
00:04:54.840 --> 00:04:58.670
might have multiple instances of
that thicker object on your page.

86
00:04:58.670 --> 00:05:01.000
So for example,
maybe all the paragraphs on your page,

87
00:05:01.000 --> 00:05:03.990
you want to have a specific type of style.

88
00:05:03.990 --> 00:05:07.930
Or you might have images that
you wanna stylize the same way,

89
00:05:07.930 --> 00:05:10.570
so if it's maybe thumbnails that you're
creating, and you might want them to all

90
00:05:10.570 --> 00:05:14.120
be the same dimension, well,
you can use a class style to do that.

91
00:05:15.200 --> 00:05:20.620
The third selector type is the ID
style type, or the ID selector.

92
00:05:20.620 --> 00:05:25.470
The ID selector can only
be used once per page, so

93
00:05:25.470 --> 00:05:28.830
they're usually reserved for
things like your content sections.

94
00:05:28.830 --> 00:05:32.080
So when we have our header,
our navigation, our footer,

95
00:05:32.080 --> 00:05:37.080
those are usually only
instantiated once on your page.

96
00:05:37.080 --> 00:05:40.830
So, specifically, you have one header
on the page, you have one footer, and

97
00:05:40.830 --> 00:05:42.730
you have one main content section.

98
00:05:42.730 --> 00:05:48.780
Therefore, you could create an ID that
identifies those and stylizes only those.

99
00:05:48.780 --> 00:05:52.610
Now that doesn't mean that your About Us
page couldn't have a header, a navigation,

100
00:05:52.610 --> 00:05:56.520
and a footer and then you'd have
an ID style that might affect that.

101
00:05:56.520 --> 00:06:01.220
But you can't have two headers on one
page that you're stylizing with an ID.

102
00:06:01.220 --> 00:06:05.830
ID can only be used once per page,
okay, so that's important.

103
00:06:05.830 --> 00:06:08.690
Now, how do you identify
these types of selectors?

104
00:06:08.690 --> 00:06:12.890
Well, a tag selector is very easy
because it's the name that you're using.

105
00:06:12.890 --> 00:06:14.180
So it's gonna be body.

106
00:06:14.180 --> 00:06:17.900
It's going to be li for list item, or

107
00:06:17.900 --> 00:06:21.470
ol for an ordered list item,
that kind of thing.

108
00:06:21.470 --> 00:06:26.720
So those are tag names, and you can see,
you can apply a style to that tag name.

109
00:06:28.098 --> 00:06:29.240
If you're gonna use a class,

110
00:06:29.240 --> 00:06:31.980
you're always going to start
the class name with a period.

111
00:06:31.980 --> 00:06:35.910
The period determines that this is a class
style that can be repeated over and

112
00:06:35.910 --> 00:06:37.560
over again on your site.

113
00:06:37.560 --> 00:06:43.629
And then lastly,
the ID style always starts with a hashtag,

114
00:06:43.629 --> 00:06:49.820
the pound sign, so
it would be #main or #footer, or #nav.

115
00:06:49.820 --> 00:06:53.810
Okay, those are the types
of IDs you would use.

116
00:06:53.810 --> 00:06:56.040
But they always start with a hashtag.
