not being able to see the OK

332
00:18:17.990 --> 00:18:19.770
button in one of my dialog boxes.

333
00:18:19.770 --> 00:18:23.310
So I started hitting the tab key on
the keyboard, which allowed me to cycle

334
00:18:23.310 --> 00:18:27.670
through each field within that dialog
box until I thought I was on OK and

335
00:18:27.670 --> 00:18:31.290
when I hit enter on the keyboard,
it automatically triggered that.

336
00:18:31.290 --> 00:18:33.040
So, I could hit tab key right now, and

337
00:18:33.040 --> 00:18:37.330
you'll see my cursor cycles through all
of the fields, just like we had earlier.

338
00:18:37.330 --> 00:18:38.350
So, that's the same thing.

339
00:18:38.350 --> 00:18:42.270
You can have the tab key work on your
website, and it will cycle through, or

340
00:18:42.270 --> 00:18:45.030
you can specify the order in
which these should go in.

341
00:18:45.030 --> 00:18:48.350
I know I've got five hyperlinks, so
I could type in the number five here and

342
00:18:48.350 --> 00:18:49.910
home will be last, okay?

343
00:18:49.910 --> 00:18:52.340
That would annoy people, but
I could make it the last one.

344
00:18:52.340 --> 00:18:55.720
Or I could jumble up all of them and
make it go in a chaotic order.

345
00:18:55.720 --> 00:18:59.908
But you want to have Home go first, About
Us go second, Company News go third, and

346
00:18:59.908 --> 00:19:00.891
so on and so forth.

347
00:19:00.891 --> 00:19:03.928
Also this will help with your search
engine optimization if you have

348
00:19:03.928 --> 00:19:04.576
that in here.

349
00:19:04.576 --> 00:19:09.480
So I'm gonna put that in there, click OK,
and now what you see is the word Home has

350
00:19:09.480 --> 00:19:13.522
become a blue hyperlink that you'd
normally see on the Internet,

351
00:19:13.522 --> 00:19:17.210
and we've now created our first hyperlink.

352
00:19:17.210 --> 00:19:21.460
Before we test the hyperlink out, I would
like to see what it looks like in code.

353
00:19:22.508 --> 00:19:27.608
So I'm gonna go to the Code view,
and right here in my list items,

354
00:19:27.608 --> 00:19:32.370
so I've got my unordered list,
you now see that I have an anchor tag.

355
00:19:32.370 --> 00:19:36.420
So here's my unordered list,
here's my individual list item and

356
00:19:36.420 --> 00:19:41.390
a list item is a container for those
items, but then I have an anchor tag.

357
00:19:41.390 --> 00:19:46.967
An anchor tag is basically
how you describe a hyperlink.

358
00:19:46.967 --> 00:19:52.402
Now the href is hypertext reference,
href stands for hypertext reference.

359
00:19:52.402 --> 00:19:55.260
And in this case, the hypertext
reference equals the Index.html, so

360
00:19:55.260 --> 00:19:58.980
it's pointing to the file that it's
gonna call up when you click on it.

361
00:19:58.980 --> 00:20:02.000
Now, everything else you
see here is an attribute.

362
00:20:02.000 --> 00:20:06.706
It's the tabindex of 1, the title says
Return to My Homepage, the accesskey is h,

363
00:20:06.706 --> 00:20:08.050
the target is _blank.

364
00:20:08.050 --> 00:20:11.490
So all those fields that we filled in,
it wrote the code for us.

365
00:20:11.490 --> 00:20:16.230
Then you can see, I close off the anchor
tag, and then I have the word Home.

366
00:20:16.230 --> 00:20:20.160
So basically, the open anchor tag,
the open a tag,

367
00:20:20.160 --> 00:20:25.320
is before the word home, and then
the closing a tag is after the word home.

368
00:20:25.320 --> 00:20:29.410
So that now tells it, hey this is
the boundaries of my hyperlink and

369
00:20:29.410 --> 00:20:31.600
that's where the hyperlink belongs.

370
00:20:31.600 --> 00:20:37.684
Okay, so now that we've created that,
I'm gonna do my Cmnd+S on a Mac,

371
00:20:37.684 --> 00:20:42.310
Ctrl+S on a PC, and
Cmnd+S on a Mac, to save the file.

372
00:20:42.310 --> 00:20:45.030
I no longer have an asterisk there.

373
00:20:45.030 --> 00:20:49.345
And now I'm gonna go down to
browse in Firefox for example.

374
00:20:49.345 --> 00:20:52.880
It'll bring it up,
it's now my default browser.

375
00:20:52.880 --> 00:20:54.160
That's okay, not now.

376
00:20:54.160 --> 00:20:56.600
But you can see now,
we're starting to build a webpage and

377
00:20:56.600 --> 00:20:58.040
here's my hyperlink, okay?

378
00:20:58.040 --> 00:20:59.930
And notice my little pointy finger.

379
00:20:59.930 --> 00:21:03.311
It actually literally shows me
that I have a hyperlink and

380
00:21:03.311 --> 00:21:07.969
when I click on it, it takes me in this
case, to my sample site, index.html.

381
00:21:07.969 --> 00:21:12.024
But notice, I told you the behavior on
Firefox is it's gonna open up _blank in

382
00:21:12.024 --> 00:21:13.879
a new tab, and that's what it did.

383
00:21:13.879 --> 00:21:18.880
I now have two tabs for the same site, but
it showed you that it actually worked.

384
00:21:18.880 --> 00:21:21.910
So I might not want that for
the home tab, for example,

385
00:21:21.910 --> 00:21:23.885
cuz you're still going
within your same site.

386
00:21:23.885 --> 00:21:27.865
You might wanna do that for external links
that you might create on your webpage.

387
00:21:27.865 --> 00:21:29.955
But in this example, I wanted to do it so

388
00:21:29.955 --> 00:21:32.555
you could see that it was
actually working, and it is.

389
00:21:32.555 --> 00:21:34.015
So fantastic.

390
00:21:34.015 --> 00:21:37.665
So I'm gonna close out of this,
close out of my browser here as well.

391
00:21:38.895 --> 00:21:41.260
And go back to my Design view.

392
00:21:41.260 --> 00:21:44.580
Now, the next thing I probably want
to talk about is changing the color,

393
00:21:45.720 --> 00:21:48.590
still finding some way to
indicate that it is a hyperlink.

394
00:21:48.590 --> 00:21:50.810
Cuz you want people to know
they're hyperlinks, right?

395
00:21:50.810 --> 00:21:52.880
You don't want it to be just text, and

396
00:21:52.880 --> 00:21:55.230
you don't want it to look like
it doesn't have that underscore.

397
00:21:55.230 --> 00:21:57.832
But you wanna do something, maybe if they
hover over it it changes the color and

398
00:21:57.832 --> 00:21:58.510
that kind of thing.

399
00:21:58.510 --> 00:22:00.790
And that's something we can
talk about at a later episode.

400
00:22:00.790 --> 00:22:06.940
But for now, that is adding hyperlinks
to your design within Dreamweaver.

401
00:22:06.940 --> 00:22:08.170
>> Thank you very much there, Jim.

402
00:22:08.170 --> 00:22:11.070
It's amazing to see these little
components behind the scenes.

403
00:22:11.070 --> 00:22:13.580
I've been browsing the Internet for
a while and

404
00:22:13.580 --> 00:22:17.560
then you actually are opening it up and
showing us what's under the hood there.

405
00:22:17.560 --> 00:22:20.110
And I noticed when you did
the little hover there,

406
00:22:20.110 --> 00:22:24.470
your information's coming up there,
that whole hover to discover, right?

407
00:22:24.470 --> 00:22:26.250
So really, really good information.

408
00:22:26.250 --> 00:22:27.410
Now, like you said,

409
00:22:27.410 --> 00:22:29.350
it does look like we're coming
to the end of another episode.

410
00:22:29.350 --> 00:22:32.736
So before we go, though,
do you have any additional words?

411
00:22:32.736 --> 00:22:36.022
>> Yes, keep in mind that when
you're working with hyperlinks,

412
00:22:36.022 --> 00:22:40.424
the guidelines are that you shouldn't have
any more than seven in your navigation,

413
00:22:40.424 --> 00:22:42.904
you shouldn't use any more than two words,
and

414
00:22:42.904 --> 00:22:45.828
you should make sure that
there's not a lot of clutter.

415
00:22:45.828 --> 00:22:48.742
That it looks organized, and
that the information is clear and concise,

416
00:22:48.742 --> 00:22:50.440
cuz you want people to
be able to navigate.

417
00:22:51.700 --> 00:22:53.990
We talked about the fact that there
are three types of hyperlinks,

418
00:22:53.990 --> 00:22:55.990
internal, external and incoming.

419
00:22:57.570 --> 00:23:02.420
So you can see the anchor tag
provides you a way to gain access to

420
00:23:03.480 --> 00:23:08.760
other pages, or
other websites out on the Internet.

421
00:23:08.760 --> 00:23:11.422
It allows your website to
become a little bit bigger,

422
00:23:11.422 --> 00:23:13.266
because you're using these links.

423
00:23:13.266 --> 00:23:15.119
>> Jim,
we do appreciate your information on this.

424
00:23:15.119 --> 00:23:16.548
And we appreciate you, the viewer.

425
00:23:16.548 --> 00:23:19.720
Signing out for ITProTV,
I've been your host, Wes Bryan.

426
00:23:19.720 --> 00:23:20.730
>> And Jim Sorrels.

427
00:23:20.730 --> 00:23:22.000
>> And we'll see you next time.

428
00:23:23.187 --> 00:23:30.770
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim demonstrate inserting multimedia files into the website. They explain the different audio file types such as MP3, OGG and WAV as well as browser compatibility for these files. They discuss different video files MP4, OGG, WebM and likewise browser compatibility for these files.
episodes.title: Inserting Multimedia Files
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.270 --> 00:00:15.349
Welcome back to another exciting
episode here in ITProTV.

3
00:00:15.349 --> 00:00:19.073
I'm your host, Wes Bryan, and in today's
episode, we're moving through and

4
00:00:19.073 --> 00:00:21.390
continuing on with our Dreamweaver series.

5
00:00:21.390 --> 00:00:24.510
That's right, we're coming back with
more of the creative cloud, 2015.

6
00:00:24.510 --> 00:00:28.000
And joining me in the studios today
is none other than Mr. Jim Surrels.

7
00:00:28.000 --> 00:00:29.350
Jim, how you doing today?

8
00:00:29.350 --> 00:00:31.960
>> I'm doing great, Wes,
thank-you for having me again today.

9
00:00:31.960 --> 00:00:33.721
And thank-you to the ITProTV team for

10
00:00:33.721 --> 00:00:36.220
allowing me to talk
more about Dreamweaver.

11
00:00:36.220 --> 00:00:40.410
And specifically, now we're going
to add some multimedia content

12
00:00:40.410 --> 00:00:42.660
into our design that
we've been working on.

13
00:00:42.660 --> 00:00:44.680
So, I have my index file open.

14
00:00:44.680 --> 00:00:45.660
We've created hyper links.

15
00:00:45.660 --> 00:00:47.610
We've added an image.

16
00:00:47.610 --> 00:00:52.784
Now, I'd like to add some content to the
main section that is multimedia in nature.

17
00:00:52.784 --> 00:00:57.130
So, it's going to be either audio or
it's going to be video in some way.

18
00:00:57.130 --> 00:01:01.400
And I'd like to talk about that
a little bit, before we add that in.

19
00:01:01.400 --> 00:01:06.170
But the good thing about HTML 5 is,
it was developed for our multimedia age.

20
00:01:06.170 --> 00:01:10.810
And it was developed for everything
that we do that is video and audio, so

21
00:01:10.810 --> 00:01:14.470
it's built for today's technologies.

22
00:01:14.470 --> 00:01:16.435
And specifically, there are tags.

23
00:01:16.435 --> 00:01:21.230
A tag called an audio tag,
or an audio HTML element and

24
00:01:21.230 --> 00:01:24.850
there's a video HTML element, as well.

25
00:01:24.850 --> 00:01:28.420
This is specific just for these items.

26
00:01:28.420 --> 00:01:32.160
When we talk about, for
example, the audio element.

27
00:01:32.160 --> 00:01:34.870
There are three file types that
we can use in our browser, or

28
00:01:34.870 --> 00:01:39.348
that browser's recognize, and
that is the .mp3 file format, okay.

29
00:01:39.348 --> 00:01:44.170
The .ogg file format, and
the .wav file format.

30
00:01:44.170 --> 00:01:45.770
However, there are caveats to that.

31
00:01:45.770 --> 00:01:48.430
Only certain browsers support all three.

32
00:01:48.430 --> 00:01:51.973
For example,
Internet Explorer doesn't support .wav or

33
00:01:51.973 --> 00:01:55.670
.ogg, and Safari doesn't support .ogg.

34
00:01:55.670 --> 00:01:59.690
Okay, so you have to keep that in mind
when you're inserting these files

35
00:01:59.690 --> 00:02:00.740
into your design.

36
00:02:00.740 --> 00:02:02.350
That you should probably cover the bases.

37
00:02:02.350 --> 00:02:07.430
Have multiple versions of that
particular audio file available.

38
00:02:07.430 --> 00:02:11.580
So this way, those browsers will catch
the one that they need kind of thing.

39
00:02:11.580 --> 00:02:15.450
So, we'll talk about inserting an audio
file and we'll talk about inserting video.

40
00:02:15.450 --> 00:02:16.860
So, video is the same thing.

41
00:02:16.860 --> 00:02:24.340
We have an HTML 5 video tag or element
tag that allows us to insert video.

42
00:02:24.340 --> 00:02:28.618
And the three file types that
are available for our video are MP4,

43
00:02:28.618 --> 00:02:33.255
OGG, and WebM.

44
00:02:33.255 --> 00:02:36.325
And again, there are couple
caveats here as well, okay.

45
00:02:36.325 --> 00:02:41.165
Not every browser supports WebM or
Ogg and that would be Internet Explorer.

46
00:02:41.165 --> 00:02:45.485
And for example, Safari doesn't
support WebM or Ogg as well.

47
00:02:45.485 --> 00:02:47.765
So, we got to keep that in mind.

48
00:02:47.765 --> 00:02:50.365
So MP4, as it seems to be
a little bit more universal.

49
00:02:50.365 --> 00:02:53.025
Just like MP3 seems to be
a little more universal, but

50
00:02:53.025 --> 00:02:58.286
some people like the lossless formats
that you can get with WAV, for example.

51
00:02:58.286 --> 00:03:00.370
WAV is going to be a larger file type,

52
00:03:00.370 --> 00:03:03.400
because it doesn't
compress the audio down.

53
00:03:03.400 --> 00:03:07.060
So, there's some drawbacks to those items.

54
00:03:07.060 --> 00:03:10.630
But we'll go with those file types,
the MP3 and the MP4, and

55
00:03:10.630 --> 00:03:12.700
we'll insert that into our design.

56
00:03:12.700 --> 00:03:15.120
And we'll talk about some
properties surrounding that, so

57
00:03:15.120 --> 00:03:18.180
at this point in time,
I'd like to dive into our application.

58
00:03:18.180 --> 00:03:21.160
And I'd like to show you where
we're going to put our first item,

59
00:03:21.160 --> 00:03:22.650
our multimedia item.

60
00:03:22.650 --> 00:03:26.340
So, the first item we're going
to use is going to be the audio.

61
00:03:26.340 --> 00:03:29.820
And we're going to select the text
where it says, content for

62
00:03:29.820 --> 00:03:31.280
new main tag goes here.

63
00:03:31.280 --> 00:03:35.300
And we're going to remove that
text by hitting the delete key.

64
00:03:35.300 --> 00:03:39.380
Again, I've got to be careful not
to have my live mode selected,

65
00:03:39.380 --> 00:03:40.300
otherwise it won't let me delete.

66
00:03:40.300 --> 00:03:45.380
But now that I've done that, with my
cursor inside that box inside the main,

67
00:03:45.380 --> 00:03:48.180
I can now insert the audio tag.

68
00:03:48.180 --> 00:03:52.920
So, if I go back up to my insert panel
here and I go further to the right.

69
00:03:52.920 --> 00:03:54.860
I will see that I have
an icon right there,

70
00:03:54.860 --> 00:03:56.948
which is a movie clip, HTML 5 video.

71
00:03:56.948 --> 00:03:59.140
If I keep going there is a speaker icon,
okay.

72
00:03:59.140 --> 00:04:00.960
So, the speaker icon lets me do audio.

73
00:04:00.960 --> 00:04:02.290
Now, there is other items you can add.

74
00:04:02.290 --> 00:04:05.920
You can add animated compositions,
you can add a canvas.

75
00:04:05.920 --> 00:04:11.690
Which lets you do things like work with
the HTML 5 canvas and do some drawings.

76
00:04:11.690 --> 00:04:14.740
There's still flash that you can add,
and you see it all the time.

77
00:04:14.740 --> 00:04:18.710
Banners that do the dancing people trying
to sell you real estate or whatever.

78
00:04:18.710 --> 00:04:21.770
We have flash video available and
then, you have some plug-ins and

79
00:04:21.770 --> 00:04:22.900
other things you can work over.

80
00:04:22.900 --> 00:04:24.560
So, there's a rollover image as well.

81
00:04:24.560 --> 00:04:28.890
Rollover images basically change into
a different image when you hover over it,

82
00:04:28.890 --> 00:04:31.060
and it reverts back when
you move off of it.

83
00:04:31.060 --> 00:04:33.340
So it's a good way to make, for example,

84
00:04:33.340 --> 00:04:36.460
your hyperlinks look like
they're animated in some way.

85
00:04:36.460 --> 00:04:39.749
So for now, we're going to choose this
HTML5 audio and click on the link.

86
00:04:40.910 --> 00:04:45.490
And when I do that, my properties panel
now changes down here to something new.

87
00:04:45.490 --> 00:04:48.260
And I'd like to scroll down
here to see what's it's at it.

88
00:04:48.260 --> 00:04:52.140
It's literally added a little
speaker icon down here

89
00:04:53.190 --> 00:04:56.250
to my graphics or to the main section.

90
00:04:56.250 --> 00:05:00.710
So basically, I have these audio
properties that I can work with.

91
00:05:00.710 --> 00:05:04.180
And I can change what's going on with
this by changing the properties.

92
00:05:05.180 --> 00:05:07.190
Now, the first thing I'd like
to point your attention to is,

93
00:05:07.190 --> 00:05:10.720
the second portion of the properties
pane has some check-boxes.

94
00:05:10.720 --> 00:05:13.360
So right now,
I have the check-box for controls.

95
00:05:13.360 --> 00:05:17.650
Basically if I uncheck this, I won't see
controls, if I check it I see controls.

96
00:05:17.650 --> 00:05:21.370
I did choose a black background here,
so I'm probably not seeing everything.

97
00:05:22.420 --> 00:05:25.500
But we'll take a look at
that here in a second.

98
00:05:25.500 --> 00:05:29.010
I also have autoplay, so when you
get to this page you can make it so

99
00:05:29.010 --> 00:05:31.140
the audio starts to play.

100
00:05:31.140 --> 00:05:34.040
I don't know about US but when I go
to some websites that automatically

101
00:05:34.040 --> 00:05:37.020
start playing music,
the first thing I do is turn it off.

102
00:05:37.020 --> 00:05:37.820
Okay, so

103
00:05:37.820 --> 00:05:41.040
if you do have a situation where you want
to have automatically playing music.

104
00:05:41.040 --> 00:05:43.130
You need to make sure you have
the controls available so

105
00:05:43.130 --> 00:05:44.110
people can turn it off.

106
00:05:44.110 --> 00:05:48.210
Otherwise you're going to get
some contact us forms filled out.

107
00:05:48.210 --> 00:05:50.000
Where people are really annoyed by you and

108
00:05:50.000 --> 00:05:53.620
your designers for creating a site that
plays music that they don't like, okay.

109
00:05:53.620 --> 00:05:55.228
So, I'm not going to choose to auto-play.

110
00:05:55.228 --> 00:05:57.800
I'm going to make it so
we have to click the play button.

111
00:05:57.800 --> 00:06:00.350
We also have the ability to
check the box for looping.

112
00:06:00.350 --> 00:06:04.210
So once the piece is over,
you can make it loop and start over again.

113
00:06:04.210 --> 00:06:07.410
Or you can even,
this kind of funny, mute it, right.

114
00:06:07.410 --> 00:06:10.810
So, you can play it but mute it at
the same time, which is kind of odd.

115
00:06:10.810 --> 00:06:12.870
So, it'll have it turned
off during playback.

116
00:06:14.120 --> 00:06:15.710
Usually, I have controls on.

117
00:06:15.710 --> 00:06:17.480
I don't always have autoplay on.

118
00:06:17.480 --> 00:06:21.800
I might have loop on, so
once it gets done it starts over again.

119
00:06:21.800 --> 00:06:26.310
But I definitely always have the controls
available for the person to choose.

120
00:06:26.310 --> 00:06:30.710
Now preload, preload means that
while the website is loading,

121
00:06:30.710 --> 00:06:34.620
what it's going to do is,
it's going to load it in the background.

122
00:06:34.620 --> 00:06:38.160
So even if they haven't hit play yet,
when they do hit play, it will be ready.

123
00:06:38.160 --> 00:06:40.930
There won't be any delay or lag time.

124
00:06:40.930 --> 00:06:42.190
There won't be any problem.

125
00:06:42.190 --> 00:06:45.400
It'll just start playing right away,
so it'll be loading behind the scenes.

126
00:06:45.400 --> 00:06:47.370
As they're reading your article or

127
00:06:47.370 --> 00:06:49.840
they're reading whatever they
need to read on your site.

128
00:06:49.840 --> 00:06:55.390
Once they get to hit the play button,
it'll be ready to go.

129
00:06:56.630 --> 00:06:59.330
And that will literally allow
it to automatically preload

130
00:06:59.330 --> 00:07:00.850
whatever is going on.

131
00:07:00.850 --> 00:07:03.390
But what I like to do right now is,
I like to point to the source.

132
00:07:03.390 --> 00:07:06.070
So I'm thinking that I don't
have my controls just yet,

133
00:07:06.070 --> 00:07:08.280
because I really haven't
specified a source.

134
00:07:08.280 --> 00:07:11.660
Okay, so
I need an audio source in order to play.

135
00:07:12.670 --> 00:07:16.830
Well in this source field right here,
I'm going to go to and

136
00:07:16.830 --> 00:07:18.360
click on this point to file.

137
00:07:18.360 --> 00:07:22.970
It used to be funny, because in CS5 and
CS6, we called this a spaghetti lasso.

138
00:07:22.970 --> 00:07:25.980
And you're going to see why it's
called spaghetti lasso in a minute.

139
00:07:25.980 --> 00:07:29.385
But, it looks like Dreamweaver has
changed the name to point to file,

140
00:07:29.385 --> 00:07:30.560
because that's literally
what I'm going to do.

141
00:07:30.560 --> 00:07:33.520
I'm going to click on that and then,
I'm going to point to the file I want.

142
00:07:33.520 --> 00:07:36.770
Now before I do that, I'm actually
going to expand some folders here, so

143
00:07:36.770 --> 00:07:39.050
I can actually see the file I want to use.

144
00:07:39.050 --> 00:07:42.910
And the file I'm going to use here is,
this EE_audio.mp3 file.

145
00:07:42.910 --> 00:07:45.690
So, I told you MP3 is one of those
that's universally accepted and

146
00:07:45.690 --> 00:07:47.420
I'm going to insert that one in there.

147
00:07:47.420 --> 00:07:48.310
So what I'm going to do is,

148
00:07:48.310 --> 00:07:53.080
I'm going to click Point to file and it
says right away, drag the file to choose.

149
00:07:53.080 --> 00:07:57.170
So, I'm going to drag it out
to the EE_audio.mp3 file.

150
00:07:57.170 --> 00:08:01.390
So right here, when I let go, that becomes
the file it's going to use for the source.

151
00:08:02.440 --> 00:08:07.400
So at this time I have my source,
I have my controls and again,

152
00:08:07.400 --> 00:08:10.550
if somebody hovers over this,
I want it to have a tip here.

153
00:08:10.550 --> 00:08:12.040
So in this case,

154
00:08:12.040 --> 00:08:16.420
maybe this is going to describe something
about an article they just read.

155
00:08:16.420 --> 00:08:21.080
Maybe, it's going to provide information
on, I don't know, anything, but,

156
00:08:21.080 --> 00:08:23.738
it could play the song that they
were looking for, anything.

157
00:08:23.738 --> 00:08:25.980
You want to describe that here,
so that when they hover over it,

158
00:08:25.980 --> 00:08:27.560
it will tell them what it's going to do.

159
00:08:27.560 --> 00:08:31.930
So we could say, listen to our latest news

160
00:08:33.170 --> 00:08:37.590
and that will bring up that screen tip
that we talked about earlier, okay.

161
00:08:37.590 --> 00:08:41.970
Fall back text is an opportunity for
if that one doesn't work for some reason.

162
00:08:41.970 --> 00:08:45.820
It'll have an opportunity to
show a separate line of text.

163
00:08:45.820 --> 00:08:48.840
Usually the title is good enough where
we shouldn't have go any further.

164
00:08:48.840 --> 00:08:51.870
So at this point,
I'd like to test this in my browser.

165
00:08:51.870 --> 00:08:55.110
And so, I'm going to save my file
with a control s on the PC or

166
00:08:55.110 --> 00:08:56.000
a command s on the Mac.

167
00:08:56.000 --> 00:08:58.600
And then, I'm going to go to
my browser settings here.

168
00:08:58.600 --> 00:09:04.020
Actually, I probably should just hit my
F12 and bring me right into Google Chrome.

169
00:09:04.020 --> 00:09:07.120
So, I'm going to do F12 here and
there it is, there's Google Chrome and

170
00:09:07.120 --> 00:09:07.960
here's my controls.

171
00:09:07.960 --> 00:09:09.120
You can see right away.

172
00:09:09.120 --> 00:09:10.880
I said content for new folder goes here,

173
00:09:10.880 --> 00:09:14.240
is right below it but
this is my place, a 32 second file.

174
00:09:14.240 --> 00:09:15.740
I can change the volume and

175
00:09:15.740 --> 00:09:19.840
I can control where it's going to go
in files, so if I hit the play here.

176
00:09:20.940 --> 00:09:26.130
I should now hear the sound and
my scrub is moving across and

177
00:09:26.130 --> 00:09:28.970
you can hear little chimes or
whatever going on.

178
00:09:28.970 --> 00:09:32.290
But the point is,
I've just added an MP3 audio that I have

179
00:09:32.290 --> 00:09:34.940
complete control over within
the design of my web page.

180
00:09:36.510 --> 00:09:39.737
Awesome, I'm going to
close out of Chrome and

181
00:09:39.737 --> 00:09:42.651
I'm going to insert into the same space.

182
00:09:42.651 --> 00:09:45.009
I'm going to insert a video file.

183
00:09:45.009 --> 00:09:49.091
So in my main content section,
I'm working with an audio file and

184
00:09:49.091 --> 00:09:52.560
I'm going to go insert a video file File.

185
00:09:52.560 --> 00:09:54.430
So, it's going to be a similar process.

186
00:09:54.430 --> 00:09:58.550
I'm going to go back up
to the insert panel and

187
00:09:58.550 --> 00:10:02.350
to the right,
I'm going to find the little movie script.

188
00:10:02.350 --> 00:10:06.350
It looks like a film reel and
I'm going to click on that.

189
00:10:06.350 --> 00:10:07.310
And where my cursor is,

190
00:10:07.310 --> 00:10:12.280
you see we've got another icon here and
this is now my video, okay.

191
00:10:12.280 --> 00:10:17.100
Again, I've got the same kind of controls
down here in the bottom section of my

192
00:10:17.100 --> 00:10:17.960
properties bar.

193
00:10:17.960 --> 00:10:20.750
I've got the controls
automatically checked.

194
00:10:20.750 --> 00:10:24.470
I've got auto-play, which in this case,
I am actually going to auto-play.

195
00:10:24.470 --> 00:10:26.674
I'm going to tell it to pre-load.

196
00:10:28.400 --> 00:10:31.050
I'm not going to loop and
I'm not going to mute.

197
00:10:31.050 --> 00:10:32.920
Keep going here.

198
00:10:32.920 --> 00:10:36.690
I could change the width and
the height of that source.

199
00:10:36.690 --> 00:10:39.350
Once I select the source, it's going
to populate the width and the height.

200
00:10:39.350 --> 00:10:41.170
But if I want the box to be smaller or
bigger,

201
00:10:41.170 --> 00:10:43.550
I could change that information here.

202
00:10:43.550 --> 00:10:46.580
Now, I have two options
here to choose from.

203
00:10:46.580 --> 00:10:48.430
I have the source and
I have a poster file.

204
00:10:48.430 --> 00:10:50.295
I'm going to talk about
what the differences are.

205
00:10:50.295 --> 00:10:52.810
We've already looked
at the source earlier.

206
00:10:52.810 --> 00:10:54.440
and I'm going to use
the spaghetti lasso or

207
00:10:54.440 --> 00:10:57.680
the point to file icon to point
to that particular video.

208
00:10:57.680 --> 00:11:01.500
Now the video I'm going to go to here is,
going to be this MP4 video for

209
00:11:01.500 --> 00:11:06.040
the history of our company and
I'm going to point to that.

210
00:11:06.040 --> 00:11:11.870
So, I'm going to click and drag to that
History.MP4 video and there, that's done.

211
00:11:11.870 --> 00:11:14.470
So now I've got the source.

212
00:11:14.470 --> 00:11:19.760
Well, what happens is, when you go to
a website and the file isn't running yet.

213
00:11:19.760 --> 00:11:24.348
Okay, it should show a snapshot of
what the file is going to look like.

214
00:11:24.348 --> 00:11:29.070
Maybe either going to be the title
of whatever the video is or

215
00:11:29.070 --> 00:11:31.940
just something that's going to
bring the interest of the person.

216
00:11:31.940 --> 00:11:35.140
To go click on it, maybe a funny
point within the video or something.

217
00:11:35.140 --> 00:11:37.000
Okay, well that's what the poster file is.

218
00:11:37.000 --> 00:11:39.580
The poster is basically
a snapshot in time.

219
00:11:39.580 --> 00:11:40.820
It could be a JPEG file.

220
00:11:40.820 --> 00:11:42.590
It could be whatever you want, but

221
00:11:42.590 --> 00:11:45.350
it's a snapshot in time
that represents the video.

222
00:11:45.350 --> 00:11:48.720
So what I'm going to do here is,
I'm going to point to the history.

223
00:11:48.720 --> 00:11:51.630
I believe it's in my
images folder here and

224
00:11:51.630 --> 00:11:55.280
I should have the history
video poster PNG file.

225
00:11:55.280 --> 00:12:01.700
So, I'm going to point to that and
what's going to happen is,

226
00:12:01.700 --> 00:12:05.030
it's going to put the poster in there and
now, you can see there's my video.

227
00:12:05.030 --> 00:12:08.350
And when I choose to view
this with my F12 key, so

228
00:12:08.350 --> 00:12:09.808
I'm going to hit F12
at this point in time.

229
00:12:09.808 --> 00:12:11.480
It's going to ask me to save.

230
00:12:11.480 --> 00:12:15.070
I didn't do the Ctrl + S or
the Cmd + S, so it's asking me to save.

231
00:12:15.070 --> 00:12:18.150
Always a fail safe within
these applications, so

232
00:12:18.150 --> 00:12:20.960
I click yes and now,
it's going to go out and here it is.

233
00:12:20.960 --> 00:12:25.210
It automatically started playing and
there's the history of our company.

234
00:12:25.210 --> 00:12:28.070
Now luckily,
my music over here is not playing.

235
00:12:28.070 --> 00:12:30.320
Therefore, there's no
conflict between the two.

236
00:12:30.320 --> 00:12:33.610
I didn't tell this to loop, so
when it's done, it'll just finish and

237
00:12:33.610 --> 00:12:35.120
we'll be done, okay.

238
00:12:35.120 --> 00:12:35.910
Now in this example,

239
00:12:35.910 --> 00:12:38.490
because I told it to autoplay I
didn't necessarily need the poster.

240
00:12:38.490 --> 00:12:42.070
So what I'm thinking is,
I'm going to go back out of Chrome.

241
00:12:42.070 --> 00:12:47.700
I'm going to tell it not to autoplay
nd I'm going to go back and view this.

242
00:12:47.700 --> 00:12:53.470
I'm going to do my F12 key again, save
the file and now, it's not auto-playing.

243
00:12:53.470 --> 00:12:56.310
but you can see a snapshot
of the video and

244
00:12:56.310 --> 00:12:59.040
I can choose to play it whenever I want,
okay.

245
00:12:59.040 --> 00:13:05.220
So we can add audio, mp3,
ogg or wav files and

246
00:13:05.220 --> 00:13:11.010
we can add video, MP4,
WebM, or aug files as well.

247
00:13:11.010 --> 00:13:15.150
And those will be available for
your browsers to detect and to work with.

248
00:13:15.150 --> 00:13:18.050
And the last thing I'd like to do is,

249
00:13:18.050 --> 00:13:20.200
I'd like to take a look at
the code that it wrote.

250
00:13:20.200 --> 00:13:24.790
So I'm going to close out of Chrome and
I want to go back into the code again.

251
00:13:24.790 --> 00:13:30.310
if you ever want to learn HTML,
let Dreamweaver write the code for

252
00:13:30.310 --> 00:13:33.600
you and then, just go in and
see what it did.

253
00:13:33.600 --> 00:13:36.760
So for example, on 37 through 39,

254
00:13:36.760 --> 00:13:40.483
I have my audio element, so
here’s the beginning audio.

255
00:13:40.483 --> 00:13:44.545
I have pre-load auto and
I have the controls turned on, so

256
00:13:44.545 --> 00:13:45.695
these were those check boxes.

257
00:13:45.695 --> 00:13:49.935
So, those are attributes within the audio
element and then, I have the source.

258
00:13:49.935 --> 00:13:53.975
So, specified the source of the file
right on this line right here.

259
00:13:53.975 --> 00:13:55.719
Then I have my closing tag for audio.

260
00:13:56.740 --> 00:13:58.690
Next, I have the video sources.

261
00:13:58.690 --> 00:14:01.740
Well, so video HTML5 video element.

262
00:14:01.740 --> 00:14:05.010
Now in this case,
because video requires a certain size,

263
00:14:05.010 --> 00:14:06.268
it requires a dimension to it.

264
00:14:06.268 --> 00:14:08.813
You've got to have somewhere to view it,
okay.

265
00:14:08.813 --> 00:14:10.546
It's specified a width and a height.

266
00:14:10.546 --> 00:14:13.190
I showed where the poster was located.

267
00:14:13.190 --> 00:14:15.040
I told it to pre-upload.

268
00:14:15.040 --> 00:14:18.060
This way, it would load in the background
I was doing, wherever I wanted to do and

269
00:14:18.060 --> 00:14:20.100
I told it to turn on the controls.

270
00:14:20.100 --> 00:14:23.490
So, those are available inside
the attributes of that element.

271
00:14:24.510 --> 00:14:26.770
Then, I have here that the source for

272
00:14:26.770 --> 00:14:32.170
this one is MP4 and notice, I also have
that the source is the video aug file.

273
00:14:32.170 --> 00:14:35.860
Remember, how I said
compatibility is important and

274
00:14:35.860 --> 00:14:39.990
I said both of those files right here and
it brought them both in.

275
00:14:39.990 --> 00:14:44.380
So, it detected that I had the Aug and
the mp4 and brought it in for me, okay.

276
00:14:44.380 --> 00:14:49.240
So at this point in time, I have both, so
whichever browser comes to my website.

277
00:14:49.240 --> 00:14:52.320
It'll find the one that works best
with that particular browser so

278
00:14:52.320 --> 00:14:53.680
it's not a big deal.

279
00:14:53.680 --> 00:14:59.850
And then lastly, I have my closing
video tag for that multimedia file.

280
00:14:59.850 --> 00:15:02.190
So in one fell swoop,

281
00:15:02.190 --> 00:15:06.370
just click in the insert panel at the top,
specify whether I want HTML video.

282
00:15:06.370 --> 00:15:11.500
Specify whether I want HTML audio.

283
00:15:11.500 --> 00:15:15.030
find the source file that you
want to point to and then,

284
00:15:15.030 --> 00:15:17.270
change the property settings.

285
00:15:17.270 --> 00:15:19.730
Turn on controls, looping, auto play,

286
00:15:19.730 --> 00:15:25.300
whatever you want and then, you've got
access to multimedia on your website.

287
00:15:25.300 --> 00:15:27.110
>> Jim, we do appreciate that information.

288
00:15:27.110 --> 00:15:30.330
The one thing I was thinking while you
were showing us that little screenshot

289
00:15:30.330 --> 00:15:32.910
there, as I know it has
gone to news sites before.

290
00:15:32.910 --> 00:15:36.610
They've got whatever the breaking story
is or maybe, it's not a breaking story.

291
00:15:36.610 --> 00:15:39.130
Maybe it's like a a documentary or
something.

292
00:15:39.130 --> 00:15:43.170
And they take that one shot that kind
of brings you in and makes you say,

293
00:15:43.170 --> 00:15:44.240
I got to click on that.

294
00:15:44.240 --> 00:15:46.530
Or if it's a marketing site or
selling you something.

295
00:15:46.530 --> 00:15:49.630
They want to show you
a feature of their product and

296
00:15:49.630 --> 00:15:52.480
they pu that still shot right there
that says, I've got to have that.

297
00:15:52.480 --> 00:15:55.098
And if I don't have that my life
is going be a lot worse off,

298
00:15:55.098 --> 00:15:56.870
so we do appreciate this information.

299
00:15:56.870 --> 00:16:00.210
But before we sign off,
do you have any additional information?

300
00:16:00.210 --> 00:16:06.080
>> Yeah I'd just like to say that again,
keep mind that audio,

301
00:16:06.080 --> 00:16:10.020
not everybody is going to like it
to auto-play, so keep that in mind.

302
00:16:10.020 --> 00:16:14.640
Don't make it auto-play unless you
absolutely have to for whatever reason.

303
00:16:14.640 --> 00:16:16.800
But always make sure
the controls are available, so

304
00:16:16.800 --> 00:16:20.550
the person feels like they have control to
change and make it do whatever they want.

305
00:16:20.550 --> 00:16:24.190
As a matter of fact,
I remember doing video classes.

306
00:16:24.190 --> 00:16:28.780
They say that your video could
be really really Bad, but

307
00:16:28.780 --> 00:16:31.760
as long as long as the audio is good,
it doesn't matter, okay.

308
00:16:31.760 --> 00:16:34.080
So, think of the Blair Witch Project,
right.?

309
00:16:34.080 --> 00:16:36.845
Video was bad but the audio was good,
so everybody still watched it.

310
00:16:36.845 --> 00:16:43.590
So, don't auto-play the audio on your
websites, that's going to be key.

311
00:16:43.590 --> 00:16:46.160
And then with the video,
just keep in mind,

312
00:16:46.160 --> 00:16:48.890
you want to be as compatible with
as many browsers as possible.

313
00:16:48.890 --> 00:16:51.610
You make sure you have multiple
versions of your file.

314
00:16:51.610 --> 00:16:53.520
So that way,
whichever browser comes to your site,

315
00:16:53.520 --> 00:16:55.940
they'll be able to see that video and
that will be important.

316
00:16:55.940 --> 00:16:57.720
>> Well we do thank you for
that information and

317
00:16:57.720 --> 00:17:00.090
we do thank you the viewer out there for
watching.

318
00:17:00.090 --> 00:17:03.046
Signing out for
ITProTV I've been your host Wes Bryan.

319
00:17:03.046 --> 00:17:03.990
>> And I'm Jim Surrels.

320
00:17:03.990 --> 00:17:06.386
>> And we'll see you next time.

321
00:17:06.386 --> 00:17:13.868
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim demonstrate to the viewer how to create, save and use templates. They discuss regions like editable regions, repeating regions and optional regions. They also take a look at tables and talk about the common usage for them.
episodes.title: Working with Templates and Tables
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:11.968 --> 00:00:14.631
Welcome back to another exciting
episode here at ITPro TV.

3
00:00:14.631 --> 00:00:16.430
I'm your host Wes Bryan and

4
00:00:16.430 --> 00:00:20.080
in today's episode we're continuing
through our series on Dreamweaver.

5
00:00:20.080 --> 00:00:22.560
That's right, we're coming back
with more Creative Cloud 2015 and

6
00:00:22.560 --> 00:00:26.360
today we're going to be looking at
working with templates and tables.

7
00:00:26.360 --> 00:00:29.040
Joining me in the studios again is
none other than Mr. Jim Searles.

8
00:00:29.040 --> 00:00:30.030
Jim, how you doing sir?

9
00:00:30.030 --> 00:00:30.880
>> I'm doing great Wes.

10
00:00:30.880 --> 00:00:33.860
Thank you for having me back and
thank you to the IT Pro TV team for

11
00:00:33.860 --> 00:00:38.530
having me as well so I can continue
my conversation about Dreamweaver.

12
00:00:38.530 --> 00:00:41.650
And specifically today,
like you said, templates and tables.

13
00:00:41.650 --> 00:00:45.380
And when we talk about templates
we talk about reusable content.

14
00:00:45.380 --> 00:00:50.590
Reuseable content is content that allows
us to not have to reinvent the wheel,

15
00:00:50.590 --> 00:00:52.230
and that's a really important piece.

16
00:00:52.230 --> 00:00:57.170
So we're gonna be talking a little
bit about the inserts panel, and

17
00:00:57.170 --> 00:01:00.050
the fact that we have categories
across the top of the insert panel.

18
00:01:00.050 --> 00:01:03.250
We've only looked at HTML categories so
far, and

19
00:01:03.250 --> 00:01:06.690
we're gonna be jumping around on
the different categories today.

20
00:01:06.690 --> 00:01:11.270
And so I'd like to draw our attention
to our application to start and

21
00:01:11.270 --> 00:01:14.050
up here at the top,
I have my insert panel and

22
00:01:14.050 --> 00:01:17.260
I want to draw your attention to
this one tab called templates.

23
00:01:17.260 --> 00:01:20.690
And there aren't many icons on this tab,

24

So at this point I'm thinking
I'll go with the three rows.

467
00:25:56.790 --> 00:25:59.070
I'll go with two columns.

468
00:25:59.070 --> 00:26:01.980
And then I'll do 200
pixels is good enough.

469
00:26:01.980 --> 00:26:03.650
Border thickness 1 is good enough.

470
00:26:03.650 --> 00:26:04.790
Just so you'll see it.

471
00:26:04.790 --> 00:26:08.690
And I'll click OK and
there is the table I just added

472
00:26:08.690 --> 00:26:11.410
with the title across the job
called Job Opportunities.

473
00:26:11.410 --> 00:26:15.210
Now all I need to do is put my
cursor inside each of the cells and

474
00:26:15.210 --> 00:26:17.640
list what each of those
job opportunities are.

475
00:26:17.640 --> 00:26:19.310
So in this example,

476
00:26:19.310 --> 00:26:22.280
I'm gonna put maybe one of
the Job Opportunities is Web Design.

477
00:26:22.280 --> 00:26:23.360
Isn't that possible?

478
00:26:23.360 --> 00:26:26.330
Look at this, you're just learning
Dreamweaver and already you can get a job.

479
00:26:26.330 --> 00:26:30.620
And I'll say that we start out at,
I don't know, 35K just for this example.

480
00:26:30.620 --> 00:26:33.110
Or I might want to list
something else here.

481
00:26:33.110 --> 00:26:36.490
But then we'll do another one and
we're gonna say that this one is,

482
00:26:36.490 --> 00:26:42.410
I don't know,
we'll say Java Development or Developer.

483
00:26:46.350 --> 00:26:47.200
And this one will be 65k.

484
00:26:47.200 --> 00:26:50.130
So there you can see
the difference between how much

485
00:26:50.130 --> 00:26:53.500
you make as a Java Developer and
how much you make as a Web \Developer.

486
00:26:53.500 --> 00:26:54.350
Just keep that in mind.

487
00:26:55.390 --> 00:27:02.590
All right, and then the last one we'll
just say is for a project manager.

488
00:27:03.590 --> 00:27:06.950
Because you've gotta have projects
that people can manage, right?

489
00:27:06.950 --> 00:27:10.350
Now I did make it only 200 pixels wide,
so that's not very wide, and

490
00:27:10.350 --> 00:27:12.600
I'll show you here that we
can change those settings.

491
00:27:12.600 --> 00:27:14.700
So I'm gonna say that this one makes,

492
00:27:14.700 --> 00:27:18.460
we'll say that they make just a little
bit less than that Java developer.

493
00:27:18.460 --> 00:27:20.080
They're in-demand.

494
00:27:20.080 --> 00:27:22.260
Okay, so I'm going to select the table.

495
00:27:22.260 --> 00:27:26.910
To do that, in my Tag Selectors down here
at the bottom I'm gonna click on Table.

496
00:27:26.910 --> 00:27:28.690
And now it changes my properties.

497
00:27:28.690 --> 00:27:31.350
Remember, I made it 200 pixels wide.

498
00:27:31.350 --> 00:27:32.370
And I don't have enough room.

499
00:27:32.370 --> 00:27:34.950
I'm getting this text wrapping here,
and I don't want that.

500
00:27:34.950 --> 00:27:36.510
So I'm going to increase the size.

501
00:27:36.510 --> 00:27:38.110
Maybe we'll try 300 pixels.

502
00:27:38.110 --> 00:27:42.390
So when I hit Enter, now I've got plenty
of room so it's only taking up one row.

503
00:27:42.390 --> 00:27:46.060
I'm not sure that I like this
thickness of these borders all around.

504
00:27:46.060 --> 00:27:47.810
So this border here is set to one.

505
00:27:47.810 --> 00:27:49.510
I can change that to zero, and

506
00:27:49.510 --> 00:27:52.670
what that'll do is it'll literally
get rid of the borders altogether.

507
00:27:52.670 --> 00:27:57.270
So when you look at this inside of
a browser now, what you're gonna see

508
00:27:57.270 --> 00:28:01.270
is just the information, and it's gonna
be lined up really nice and good.

509
00:28:01.270 --> 00:28:03.070
Now notice it is left-aligned,

510
00:28:03.070 --> 00:28:06.520
a lot like the content we've been
working with, we have to tell it hey,

511
00:28:06.520 --> 00:28:10.480
don't make that left-aligned, set the
margins of that to automatically adjust.

512
00:28:10.480 --> 00:28:15.510
Or even text align that editable region,
so that way they're central.

513
00:28:15.510 --> 00:28:16.410
Let me try that here.

514
00:28:16.410 --> 00:28:18.440
So it looks like it's centered here.

515
00:28:18.440 --> 00:28:24.610
So if I click in this main editable
region right here, I can select that.

516
00:28:24.610 --> 00:28:27.690
And I can go into my CSS designer panel.

517
00:28:27.690 --> 00:28:31.376
And I should be able to add a new style,
Main Wrapper here, and

518
00:28:31.376 --> 00:28:36.190
when I hit Enter, can't make these
changes, here's what's happening.

519
00:28:36.190 --> 00:28:40.230
Here, I attempted to add a new
style into a document that has

520
00:28:40.230 --> 00:28:44.270
an associated template, and
it's telling me that I can't make a change

521
00:28:44.270 --> 00:28:47.880
because it will require a code
to be edited in the template and

522
00:28:47.880 --> 00:28:51.040
I don't allow code editing in
the template except in the main section.

523
00:28:51.040 --> 00:28:57.400
So I can't do it inside of this page,
I have to do it in the template.

524
00:28:57.400 --> 00:28:59.360
So what I'm gonna do is click OK.

525
00:28:59.360 --> 00:29:04.950
So now I'm going to move
to the my template file.

526
00:29:04.950 --> 00:29:10.610
And I'm going to go into my CSS
designer here in the upper right.

527
00:29:10.610 --> 00:29:14.020
And I do see that I have
a Wrapper Main already created, so

528
00:29:14.020 --> 00:29:17.810
there's a style already for the Main
where we've got our editable region.

529
00:29:17.810 --> 00:29:20.850
But I'd like to duplicate this and
add the table to it.

530
00:29:20.850 --> 00:29:24.470
So if there's a table inside of Main,
it's gonna take on these settings.

531
00:29:24.470 --> 00:29:27.980
so I'm gonna right click,
and choose Duplicate, and

532
00:29:27.980 --> 00:29:33.850
then from here I'm gonna actually
add the table tag to that code.

533
00:29:33.850 --> 00:29:35.470
So you can write in your own code.

534
00:29:35.470 --> 00:29:37.910
You don't have to click on an item and

535
00:29:37.910 --> 00:29:41.310
then receive it as a dynamic link,
you could just write it in.

536
00:29:41.310 --> 00:29:45.348
So when I hit Enter here it's
going to allow me to now

537
00:29:45.348 --> 00:29:49.160
stylize the settings for this code.

538
00:29:49.160 --> 00:29:52.510
So I'm gonna design Wrapper Main table.

539
00:29:52.510 --> 00:29:54.170
I come into this list.

540
00:29:54.170 --> 00:29:57.205
And, I'm going to come right here where
it says margins, and I'll put auto.

541
00:29:58.923 --> 00:29:59.920
And I'm gonna hit enter.

542
00:30:01.020 --> 00:30:03.350
And, I'm gonna go to text, and
make sure it's center, which it is,

543
00:30:03.350 --> 00:30:04.200
it's center aligned.

544
00:30:04.200 --> 00:30:05.430
But that should take care of it.

545
00:30:05.430 --> 00:30:09.400
Doing the Margins Auto on the table,
should make it so that way, and

546
00:30:09.400 --> 00:30:13.090
the table will now autoalign
just like our web page does.

547
00:30:13.090 --> 00:30:14.740
It autoaligns no matter where we do it.

548
00:30:14.740 --> 00:30:16.560
So here's the thing.

549
00:30:16.560 --> 00:30:19.500
I've created this, and you can see
right up here, I've got these stars.

550
00:30:19.500 --> 00:30:21.730
It tells me I made
a change to my template.

551
00:30:21.730 --> 00:30:26.560
Therefore, if I save this template with
my Ctrl+S or Cmd+S on the Mac, it says,

552
00:30:26.560 --> 00:30:29.550
hey, now that you're making this change,

553
00:30:29.550 --> 00:30:32.530
you need to update every
single one of the files.

554
00:30:32.530 --> 00:30:35.310
Even though I've got a couple of them
open, they're going to update them,

555
00:30:35.310 --> 00:30:38.230
and it's gonna write the code in there for
what i just did.

556
00:30:38.230 --> 00:30:42.900
So if I say update, it will
automatically update all of the files.

557
00:30:42.900 --> 00:30:43.760
They're done, okay?

558
00:30:43.760 --> 00:30:45.280
So I click close.

559
00:30:45.280 --> 00:30:49.790
And notice now, I now have an asterisk
on index at HTML right here.

560
00:30:49.790 --> 00:30:53.170
And I have an asterisk on careers, that
means that they've applied the changes,

561
00:30:53.170 --> 00:30:55.720
I just haven't saved them yet
because they were open.

562
00:30:55.720 --> 00:30:57.610
But any file that was closed or

563
00:30:57.610 --> 00:31:00.980
not open automatically got the update
without having to worry about it.

564
00:31:00.980 --> 00:31:05.590
So for these two, I'd have to click
here and do my Ctrl- or Cmd-S, and

565
00:31:05.590 --> 00:31:09.540
then click on this one, and since I wanna
preview this to see if it actually worked,

566
00:31:09.540 --> 00:31:13.480
I'm gonna do my F12, which will
ask me to save, I'll say yes, and

567
00:31:13.480 --> 00:31:17.060
now you can see that the table
is now centered to that page.

568
00:31:18.180 --> 00:31:22.430
So at this point we've learned
that we can use the template

569
00:31:22.430 --> 00:31:26.140
to create multiple pages
within our design and

570
00:31:26.140 --> 00:31:30.030
we can quickly create multiple pages cuz
it doesn't require a lot of thought.

571
00:31:30.030 --> 00:31:33.500
But now I just need to customize
each page to make it, so

572
00:31:33.500 --> 00:31:36.750
that way I have interesting content
that's specific to that page.

573
00:31:36.750 --> 00:31:38.540
So, I'm gonna go back to About Us.

574
00:31:38.540 --> 00:31:39.470
Notice there's nothing there.

575
00:31:39.470 --> 00:31:40.710
Home, there's nothing there.

576
00:31:40.710 --> 00:31:42.000
And I haven't created my link yet for

577
00:31:42.000 --> 00:31:45.350
Careers, which would take me back to
that page with that table in there.

578
00:31:47.350 --> 00:31:53.330
Okay, so
at this point we've learned templates and

579
00:31:53.330 --> 00:31:58.540
we've learned table information and we've
learned how to use CSS styling to work

580
00:31:58.540 --> 00:32:03.650
with that table styles and
how to use it to change information.

581
00:32:03.650 --> 00:32:05.510
I'd like to take a look at
the structure of the table,

582
00:32:05.510 --> 00:32:07.230
just to show you what
the code looks like again.

583
00:32:07.230 --> 00:32:10.010
So if you're trying to learn,
we can see what that's gonna look like.

584
00:32:10.010 --> 00:32:15.760
So if I go into my table, you'll see
all the blue code starting at line 79.

585
00:32:15.760 --> 00:32:17.180
Here's the initial table.

586
00:32:17.180 --> 00:32:20.070
There's that caption that we wrote for
accessibility.

587
00:32:20.070 --> 00:32:24.680
Here is the table body, which has all
of my table rows, and the table data.

588
00:32:24.680 --> 00:32:27.230
So a table row is one of the rows, but

589
00:32:27.230 --> 00:32:30.840
a table data is actually a column
within that row and I had two columns.

590
00:32:30.840 --> 00:32:33.600
So there's the column of information,
okay?

591
00:32:33.600 --> 00:32:34.470
So that's how I wrote it.

592
00:32:34.470 --> 00:32:39.600
And then of course I have my closing table
here, and my closing table body as well.

593
00:32:39.600 --> 00:32:42.630
So those two are inside of
the editable region that we had.

594
00:32:42.630 --> 00:32:43.640
>> All right.

595
00:32:43.640 --> 00:32:44.400
>> Fantastic.

596
00:32:44.400 --> 00:32:45.540
>> I appreciate that, Jim.

597
00:32:45.540 --> 00:32:47.880
A lot of information on templates and
tables,

598
00:32:47.880 --> 00:32:50.180
it does look like though we're coming
to the end of another episode.

599
00:32:50.180 --> 00:32:53.870
But before we sign off, got any additional
information you would like to tell us?

600
00:32:53.870 --> 00:32:55.150
>> Sure, thanks Wes.

601
00:32:56.250 --> 00:32:59.180
Just keep in mind that
working with templates,

602
00:32:59.180 --> 00:33:02.170
you always have to have
an editable region.

603
00:33:02.170 --> 00:33:05.550
Without an editable region, you're just
creating pages that are exactly the same,

604
00:33:05.550 --> 00:33:07.000
but you can't do anything with them.

605
00:33:07.000 --> 00:33:11.960
So, I like to go to my Insert panel and
make sure I'm working with this

606
00:33:11.960 --> 00:33:14.730
because this kind of guides me as
to what I'm going to need here.

607
00:33:14.730 --> 00:33:18.450
So all these little wonderful icons,
the repeating region,

608
00:33:18.450 --> 00:33:22.906
the optional region, those kinds of
things, it helps guide me to what I need.

609
00:33:22.906 --> 00:33:28.140
So, templates, editable regions,

610
00:33:28.140 --> 00:33:31.950
and the fact that I can add content
inside of the editable region,

611
00:33:31.950 --> 00:33:37.420
and apply those templates to multiple
pages, and you can see quickly and easily,

612
00:33:37.420 --> 00:33:42.470
I can build a web page based on
that template and it updates

613
00:33:42.470 --> 00:33:46.070
automatically any time that I update
the template, updates all of the pages.

614
00:33:46.070 --> 00:33:48.340
So if you have 50 pages that
are based on a template,

615
00:33:48.340 --> 00:33:50.830
they'll all update exactly the same way.

616
00:33:50.830 --> 00:33:54.330
>> Jim we appreciate all that information,
we appreciate you the viewer watching.

617
00:33:54.330 --> 00:33:55.580
Singing out for IT Pro TV.

618
00:33:55.580 --> 00:33:57.370
I've been your host Wes Bryan.

619
00:33:57.370 --> 00:33:58.260
>> And I'm Jim Searles.

620
00:33:58.260 --> 00:34:00.144
>> And we'll see you next time.

621
00:34:00.144 --> 00:34:08.350
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim introduce creating forms. They explain the properties of forms like form ID, action, method, target, enctype and class. They also look at various form elements such as text fields, hidden fields, textarea, checkbox groups and more.
episodes.title: Creating Forms
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:11.776 --> 00:00:14.461
Welcome back to another exciting
episode here on ITProTV.

3
00:00:14.461 --> 00:00:17.250
I'm your host Wes Bryan,
and in today's episode,

4
00:00:17.250 --> 00:00:19.790
we are continuing through
our Dreamweaver series.

5
00:00:19.790 --> 00:00:21.500
That's right.
We're coming back with more of that

6
00:00:21.500 --> 00:00:22.911
creative cloud, 2015.

7
00:00:22.911 --> 00:00:25.580
And we're looking at creating forms.

8
00:00:25.580 --> 00:00:28.370
Joining me back in the studios today
is none other than Mr. Jim Searles.

9
00:00:28.370 --> 00:00:29.690
Jim, how you doing, sir?

10
00:00:29.690 --> 00:00:31.850
>> Wes, I'm doing great, and
thank you for having me back.

11
00:00:31.850 --> 00:00:35.350
Also, thank you to the ITProTV team for
having me, as well.

12
00:00:35.350 --> 00:00:37.080
I appreciate talking about Dream Weaver.

13
00:00:37.080 --> 00:00:40.100
And today is a wonderful topic
because it's very important.

14
00:00:40.100 --> 00:00:44.270
It's all about forms and
adding form controls to your design.

15
00:00:44.270 --> 00:00:47.880
And making sure that you can
gather feedback from your users.

16
00:00:47.880 --> 00:00:50.300
And so that's why it's important.

17
00:00:50.300 --> 00:00:54.880
So we've been creating a design,
and we do have a Contact Us page.

18
00:00:54.880 --> 00:01:00.430
And it's where the Contact Us page is is
that we want to add the form controls.

19
00:01:00.430 --> 00:01:04.550
And when we do this, we're literally
going to work in the Properties panel.

20
00:01:04.550 --> 00:01:07.040
If you've been following
along in other episodes we've

21
00:01:07.040 --> 00:01:09.980
been working in the Properties panel for
these particular objects.

22
00:01:09.980 --> 00:01:13.370
But it's in the Properties panel that I
wanna talk about some important pieces

23
00:01:13.370 --> 00:01:14.440
of the form.

24
00:01:14.440 --> 00:01:18.980
Because the way the form works it's meant
to provide you with some results and

25
00:01:18.980 --> 00:01:19.630
some feedback.

26
00:01:19.630 --> 00:01:23.790
So you're gonna have to understand some
pieces here that connect a server, or

27
00:01:23.790 --> 00:01:26.440
that may email them out,
or whatever, however

28
00:01:26.440 --> 00:01:30.280
you're gonna manage the information
that's gonna be important in there.

29
00:01:30.280 --> 00:01:34.930
So we're gonna go back
into our application and

30
00:01:34.930 --> 00:01:39.150
we're gonna take a look at
the Insert panel up here at the top.

31
00:01:39.150 --> 00:01:42.480
And we're literally gonna go
to the Form category here.

32
00:01:43.660 --> 00:01:47.670
Now we're gonna talk about
these icons inside of the Form

33
00:01:47.670 --> 00:01:49.540
category on the Insert panel.

34
00:01:49.540 --> 00:01:52.000
But the one all the way to
the left is a form control.

35
00:01:52.000 --> 00:01:56.000
That will literally
establish in our design,

36
00:01:56.000 --> 00:02:00.200
that we are building a form, and
that we're putting it inside of this area.

37
00:02:00.200 --> 00:02:03.100
Now in a previous episode we talked
about creating a template, and

38
00:02:03.100 --> 00:02:06.370
I currently only have my 'Contact
Us' page with an editable region and

39
00:02:06.370 --> 00:02:10.435
it's in the main section here,
that I am gonna add those form controls.

40
00:02:10.435 --> 00:02:15.005
So, I am going to delete the word
'main' and I'm gonna insert the form.

41
00:02:15.005 --> 00:02:16.505
So, literally insert the form and

42
00:02:16.505 --> 00:02:21.500
what you're gonna see is, a box with a red
border appear, and now you'll see down

43
00:02:21.500 --> 00:02:25.620
here in the properties panel I have
the ability to work with the form.

44
00:02:25.620 --> 00:02:29.140
So here's where we gonna have
a conversation about the form

45
00:02:29.140 --> 00:02:31.010
properties on your page.

46
00:02:32.520 --> 00:02:34.150
So we're going to start with the form id.

47
00:02:35.320 --> 00:02:37.750
Form1 tells you the form
that you're using.

48
00:02:37.750 --> 00:02:40.890
You may have many different types
of forms on your website and

49
00:02:40.890 --> 00:02:43.820
you need to label them, in order to
understand which one you're working with.

50
00:02:43.820 --> 00:02:46.710
Or, which one you've
received the feedback from.

51
00:02:46.710 --> 00:02:48.220
That'll be very important for that.

52
00:02:48.220 --> 00:02:52.900
So in this case, this is our contact us,
so I'm actually gonna call it contact.

53
00:02:52.900 --> 00:02:54.425
And get my spelling right here.

54
00:02:54.425 --> 00:02:56.445
Contact form.

55
00:02:56.445 --> 00:02:57.665
And literally, that's what it is.

56
00:02:57.665 --> 00:03:00.225
It's identifying what
form this relates to.

57
00:03:00.225 --> 00:03:02.585
And it's saying it's coming
from the contact page.

58
00:03:02.585 --> 00:03:06.212
So if I hit the tab key for
example, now that's locked in.

59
00:03:06.212 --> 00:03:09.722
The class, if I've created a class
using my styles, I can apply that.

60
00:03:09.722 --> 00:03:15.202
So if I've got some items I wanna be
consistent with across multiple pages,

61
00:03:15.202 --> 00:03:17.152
I can apply that class here.

62
00:03:17.152 --> 00:03:20.501
Not this is where we start to
get important, this action and

63
00:03:20.501 --> 00:03:22.771
this method section here.

64
00:03:22.771 --> 00:03:26.281
So the action determines how you're
going to handle the results.

65
00:03:26.281 --> 00:03:31.091
So literally you could specify either the
form script that you might get from your

66
00:03:32.171 --> 00:03:33.701
website provider.

67
00:03:33.701 --> 00:03:38.460
Or you might include here the email
address that you want to send this to.

68
00:03:38.460 --> 00:03:42.660
Now it's not standard in this day and
age to use an email address.

69
00:03:42.660 --> 00:03:43.970
And here's why.

70
00:03:43.970 --> 00:03:47.130

So again, I go through some settings,
I can set a max length.

521
00:27:02.060 --> 00:27:02.950
You know what?

522
00:27:02.950 --> 00:27:06.840
I can't predict what somebody's domain
might be or somebody's user name might be,

523
00:27:06.840 --> 00:27:10.420
so I'm not even going to attempt
to get me a max length here, but

524
00:27:10.420 --> 00:27:16.640
I will add my title, which is going to
be please type in your email address.

525
00:27:18.460 --> 00:27:21.160
And then the placeholder,
I could give them a sample,

526
00:27:21.160 --> 00:27:26.560
I could say sample@sample.com,
for example.

527
00:27:26.560 --> 00:27:33.560
This is a required field, and, everything
else here, tab index is number three.

528
00:27:35.000 --> 00:27:37.790
And it's the fact that it's
an email should automatically

529
00:27:37.790 --> 00:27:40.550
validate against email addresses.

530
00:27:40.550 --> 00:27:43.250
The feedback text area,
little bit different.

531
00:27:43.250 --> 00:27:48.131
Text area here,
I'm going to give this a name,

532
00:27:48.131 --> 00:27:52.282
we're going to call this our feedback,

533
00:27:52.282 --> 00:27:57.340
lower case to maintain my consistency.

534
00:27:57.340 --> 00:27:59.840
Now, number of rows and
columns you're going to allow.

535
00:27:59.840 --> 00:28:02.200
So, am I going to allow multiple rows?

536
00:28:02.200 --> 00:28:05.350
Usually up to five rows, for example.

537
00:28:05.350 --> 00:28:07.040
I'm not going to put a max length.

538
00:28:07.040 --> 00:28:11.550
Notice as I chose five rows, it increased
the height of the field, and that's great.

539
00:28:11.550 --> 00:28:14.860
And the text wrap says default,
hard, or soft.

540
00:28:14.860 --> 00:28:17.495
And basically, it'll give you
hard returns or soft returns.

541
00:28:17.495 --> 00:28:21.805
And basically a soft return is where it
moves the date to the second line, but

542
00:28:21.805 --> 00:28:24.265
it doesn't really break it.

543
00:28:24.265 --> 00:28:27.525
Hard return means once you get to the end,
it creates a separate line, but

544
00:28:27.525 --> 00:28:29.920
it's going to give you a hard
break at that second line.

545
00:28:29.920 --> 00:28:31.860
Okay, so
it's just going to be the default here.

546
00:28:33.210 --> 00:28:34.780
Value, again, I don't want anything.

547
00:28:34.780 --> 00:28:37.391
Title, this is please
provide us your feedback.

548
00:28:42.748 --> 00:28:47.450
Your feedback.

549
00:28:47.450 --> 00:28:50.030
And I apologize my screen
resolution is making it so

550
00:28:50.030 --> 00:28:52.010
you can't see the entire field again.

551
00:28:52.010 --> 00:28:52.820
Let's stretch that out.

552
00:28:52.820 --> 00:28:56.810
So please provide us your feedback,
and the placeholder is going to be

553
00:28:56.810 --> 00:29:01.250
a 'Type feedback' here.

554
00:29:01.250 --> 00:29:03.520
And then, this is a required field?

555
00:29:03.520 --> 00:29:06.210
Not really, they can give us
feedback if they want, however,

556
00:29:06.210 --> 00:29:09.220
if they fill out this form and
they don't give us this information,

557
00:29:09.220 --> 00:29:12.978
they're giving us their email address for
free, and that's fine.

558
00:29:12.978 --> 00:29:17.630
Again, disabled auto-focus, read only,
don't need any of that, tab index at this

559
00:29:17.630 --> 00:29:21.180
point is number four, and then we're
on the last item, the radio button.

560
00:29:21.180 --> 00:29:27.108
So I'm going to click on the radio button,
select it, and now you can see here,

561
00:29:27.108 --> 00:29:32.084
the name of this is radio, again,
I'm going to say contact user.

562
00:29:40.060 --> 00:29:42.720
And no spaces, user.

563
00:29:42.720 --> 00:29:46.390
And again, I can make it so
it's checked by default.

564
00:29:46.390 --> 00:29:50.760
So if I want them to automatically
say yes for contact,

565
00:29:50.760 --> 00:29:53.110
select this if you want us to contact you.

566
00:29:53.110 --> 00:29:56.650
This checkbox automatically puts
the blue dot in the center so

567
00:29:56.650 --> 00:29:59.650
that means yes we will contact
you unless you take this off.

568
00:29:59.650 --> 00:30:03.260
So you're opting them in or
you're opting them out.

569
00:30:03.260 --> 00:30:05.600
In this case,
I don't think I want to check this.

570
00:30:05.600 --> 00:30:07.050
I want them to have to opt in so

571
00:30:07.050 --> 00:30:09.650
they specifically have to request
that we're going to contact them.

572
00:30:09.650 --> 00:30:13.692
Otherwise we'd be contacting everybody,
even though they don't want to.

573
00:30:13.692 --> 00:30:18.779
The value is a radio button, the title is

574
00:30:18.779 --> 00:30:23.580
going to be select if you wish

575
00:30:23.580 --> 00:30:29.002
a response from us.

576
00:30:29.002 --> 00:30:31.464
Okay?

577
00:30:31.464 --> 00:30:36.870
Again, disabled required auto focus.

578
00:30:36.870 --> 00:30:38.420
What form are we going to apply this to?

579
00:30:38.420 --> 00:30:41.270
And then this is the last number five.

580
00:30:41.270 --> 00:30:44.030
Okay, and of course I have
forgotten to add my buttons.

581
00:30:44.030 --> 00:30:48.510
So I want to go to the end here and
I've got my submit button, and

582
00:30:48.510 --> 00:30:51.510
then right to the right of that,
I'm going to put my reset button.

583
00:30:51.510 --> 00:30:56.260
So this will allow them to submit the form
and it will allow them to reset the form.

584
00:30:56.260 --> 00:30:57.260
Right.
So this one,

585
00:30:57.260 --> 00:31:00.740
I think I'm ready to just to
test the bare bones form here.

586
00:31:00.740 --> 00:31:06.740
And if I go into F12 to preview this in my
browser, I can literally test this out.

587
00:31:06.740 --> 00:31:09.410
So, here's my form with all of its fields.

588
00:31:09.410 --> 00:31:12.150
Okay, and I can use CSS styling
here to fix all of this.

589
00:31:12.150 --> 00:31:14.810
But it says insert first name here,
insert last name here.

590
00:31:14.810 --> 00:31:18.350
It says, you can look at my screen tips,
it's giving me all that information.

591
00:31:18.350 --> 00:31:20.980
All right, so let me put some
information here just to test it.

592
00:31:23.770 --> 00:31:26.950
Jim Searles, and my email.

593
00:31:26.950 --> 00:31:29.980
I'm going to leave the email address
blank just to show you what happens.

594
00:31:29.980 --> 00:31:35.880
I'm going to say thank you for
helping us out.

595
00:31:37.710 --> 00:31:41.000
And I'm not going to check that,
but if I hit submit

596
00:31:41.000 --> 00:31:43.680
it should not allow it to happen,
it says please fill out this field.

597
00:31:43.680 --> 00:31:46.653
So by making it mandatory,
it's giving me that information.

598
00:31:46.653 --> 00:31:50.675
Now I'm going to make a mistake, I'm not
going to give a proper email address, so

599
00:31:50.675 --> 00:31:53.672
I'm going to say jimbo and
I'm going to say at, the word at.

600
00:31:53.672 --> 00:31:56.825
And I'm going to say jimbo.com,
for example.

601
00:31:56.825 --> 00:32:00.175
It's not an appropriate email address,
so I'm gonna hit Submit again, and

602
00:32:00.175 --> 00:32:02.660
it says Please include an @
symbol in the email address.

603
00:32:02.660 --> 00:32:05.800
So it is testing the information
to make sure it's provided here.

604
00:32:05.800 --> 00:32:10.070
So that validation is completely doing
its job, and this is part of HTML5.

605
00:32:10.070 --> 00:32:13.470
Cuz I will tell you,
before HTML5, I had to go in,

606
00:32:13.470 --> 00:32:18.280
after creating the fields, and I would
have to select JavaScript validation.

607
00:32:18.280 --> 00:32:21.870
So it was a whole separate step and
process for every single field.

608
00:32:21.870 --> 00:32:23.510
But now, it's working great.

609
00:32:23.510 --> 00:32:26.400
And I spelled Jimbo wrong here,
but that's okay.

610
00:32:26.400 --> 00:32:29.230
And then I go over here, and
I say, yeah, you can contact me.

611
00:32:29.230 --> 00:32:29.859
I'll hit Submit.

612
00:32:31.280 --> 00:32:36.030
Instantly it's going to hit submitted,
it should've send out the email.

613
00:32:36.030 --> 00:32:37.890
There it is,
it's trying to open my Outlook.

614
00:32:37.890 --> 00:32:40.690
And there's the email with
my information in it.

615
00:32:40.690 --> 00:32:44.030
And all of this good stuff is
coming up because it's Outlook.

616
00:32:44.030 --> 00:32:48.860
But at this point, I'm not sure
what's going on with this guy.

617
00:32:48.860 --> 00:32:50.120
But there's my information.

618
00:32:50.120 --> 00:32:54.275
Jim, last name was Searles,
email is jimbo@jimbo.com,

619
00:32:54.275 --> 00:32:56.950
feedback is thank you for helping us.

620
00:32:56.950 --> 00:32:57.770
And there you are.

621
00:32:57.770 --> 00:33:00.670
So we have all of that
information based on this.

622
00:33:00.670 --> 00:33:02.450
And I'm not sure why this is stuck.

623
00:33:02.450 --> 00:33:03.700
There we go.

624
00:33:03.700 --> 00:33:04.500
Goodness gracious.

625
00:33:06.740 --> 00:33:08.700
And my submit was equals to submit.

626
00:33:08.700 --> 00:33:11.490
My contact user was the radio button,
so that's the value.

627
00:33:11.490 --> 00:33:14.420
I should have charged the value there,
so that's something I want to go change.

628
00:33:14.420 --> 00:33:20.960
So where it said the value for the radio
button, I could say, please contact me.

629
00:33:24.590 --> 00:33:26.870
This will let us know that
they do wanna be contacted.

630
00:33:26.870 --> 00:33:28.620
So if they select it,
that's what gonna say.

631
00:33:28.620 --> 00:33:33.060
So now, if I hit Tab on this and
I preview it again.

632
00:33:36.090 --> 00:33:39.160
I go through my fields, and notice it's
not gonna auto populate my information.

633
00:33:39.160 --> 00:33:40.500
Well I guess it is auto populating.

634
00:33:40.500 --> 00:33:42.290
I guess I didn't tell it not to.

635
00:33:42.290 --> 00:33:44.610
Maybe this is something
on the browser level.

636
00:33:44.610 --> 00:33:46.876
Gonna have to see what's going on there.

637
00:33:46.876 --> 00:33:49.252
But here's my information.

638
00:33:52.549 --> 00:33:56.910
And lastly, feedback, thank you!

639
00:33:56.910 --> 00:33:58.800
Select this, now I hit the Submit form.

640
00:34:00.390 --> 00:34:03.770
Hopefully I don't blow up Outlook again,
and all those messages that we got.

641
00:34:08.050 --> 00:34:08.810
And there it is.

642
00:34:08.810 --> 00:34:12.220
Now it says,
please contact me instead of radio.

643
00:34:12.220 --> 00:34:16.210
So basically, now I know that they
wanna be contacted in that sense, okay.

644
00:34:16.210 --> 00:34:20.180
So this is the email that's going to
get sent when the form is completed.

645
00:34:20.180 --> 00:34:26.400
And so there we have a HTML5 form
within our design, using all

646
00:34:26.400 --> 00:34:31.230
of the HTML5 configuration settings that
we have available inside of Dreamweaver.

647
00:34:32.420 --> 00:34:33.620
>> All right, thank you very much.

648
00:34:33.620 --> 00:34:38.480
A lot of intricate pieces there, Jim, but
I appreciate you explaining it for us.

649
00:34:38.480 --> 00:34:41.683
Do you have any other
words before we sign off?

650
00:34:41.683 --> 00:34:45.043
>> Sure, just keep in mind
when you're completing a form,

651
00:34:45.043 --> 00:34:49.320
again, the bare bones that you need
is first name, last name and email.

652
00:34:49.320 --> 00:34:52.920
And then you need a submit button and
a reset button.

653
00:34:53.960 --> 00:34:58.490
Very important, all of the other fields
that we talked about are not mandatory,

654
00:34:58.490 --> 00:34:59.720
they're optional.

655
00:34:59.720 --> 00:35:03.060
But you'll want to make your first name,
your last name, your email as required

656
00:35:03.060 --> 00:35:06.370
fields, and then you'll want to have
the submit and reset button on every form.

657
00:35:06.370 --> 00:35:08.470
>> All right,
well we appreciate that information,

658
00:35:08.470 --> 00:35:11.220
appreciate you being here with us,
and we appreciate you the viewer.

659
00:35:11.220 --> 00:35:14.400
Signing off for ITProTV,
I've been your host Wes Bryan.

660
00:35:14.400 --> 00:35:15.270
>> And I'm Jim Searles.

661
00:35:15.270 --> 00:35:16.317
>> And we'll see you next time.

662
00:35:16.317 --> 00:35:22.355
[NOISE]

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim walk through several design principles to guide the viewer through best practices such as,knowing who you are design to, copyright and infringement concerns and more.
episodes.title: Principles of Web Design
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.024 --> 00:00:10.024
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:11.852 --> 00:00:15.989
Welcome back to another exciting episode
here at ITProTV, I'm your host Wes Bryan,

3
00:00:15.989 --> 00:00:19.060
and we're continuing along in
our series in Dreamweaver.

4
00:00:19.060 --> 00:00:22.480
That's right, we're coming back with
more of the Creative Cloud 2015.

5
00:00:22.480 --> 00:00:23.390
In this episode,

6
00:00:23.390 --> 00:00:26.320
we're going to be focusing in
on the principles of web design.

7
00:00:26.320 --> 00:00:29.150
Joining me back in the studios again
is none other than Mr. Jim Seros.

8
00:00:29.150 --> 00:00:30.310
Jim, how you doing, sir?

9
00:00:30.310 --> 00:00:32.370
>> I'm doing great, Wes,
thank you for having me back, and

10
00:00:32.370 --> 00:00:34.990
thank you to the ITProTV team for
having me as well.

11
00:00:34.990 --> 00:00:37.300
So we can talk about Dreamweaver, however,

12
00:00:37.300 --> 00:00:40.650
in this instance we're not going to be
talking about Dreamweaver as much as we're

13
00:00:40.650 --> 00:00:43.170
going to be talking about
the principles of design.

14
00:00:43.170 --> 00:00:46.580
And for the purpose of understanding
how to build a web page,

15
00:00:46.580 --> 00:00:50.460
we're going to do a PowerPoint
presentation outside of the applications

16
00:00:50.460 --> 00:00:54.870
that we're going to talk about layout and
symmetry and that kind of thing.

17
00:00:54.870 --> 00:00:58.060
So I'd like to dive into my
PowerPoint presentation and

18
00:00:58.060 --> 00:00:59.850
talk about the principles of design.

19
00:00:59.850 --> 00:01:03.040
Basically, a well designed website
facilitates easy navigation through web

20
00:01:03.040 --> 00:01:05.530
pages for
accessing the relevant information.

21
00:01:05.530 --> 00:01:10.360
Now we've talked about this before,
how our design must be clean.

22
00:01:10.360 --> 00:01:12.850
It must be user friendly.

23
00:01:12.850 --> 00:01:16.430
You're going to have this focus
on the user at all times.

24
00:01:16.430 --> 00:01:18.970
And we're going to discuss
some concepts in a little bit

25
00:01:18.970 --> 00:01:22.450
about who your target audience is,
and what it is that you're looking for

26
00:01:22.450 --> 00:01:24.590
when you're designing this information.

27
00:01:24.590 --> 00:01:26.380
So, let's dive into that.

28
00:01:26.380 --> 00:01:31.540
So the first part is to look at some
guidelines for the design principles.

29
00:01:31.540 --> 00:01:34.910
We need to ask some questions to
determine the purpose of our site.

30
00:01:34.910 --> 00:01:36.640
Who is going to be coming to our site?

31
00:01:36.640 --> 00:01:37.710
Is it a specialty site?

32
00:01:37.710 --> 00:01:39.070
Are we going to design a blog?

33
00:01:39.070 --> 00:01:41.760
Are we going to design
something that's informational?

34
00:01:41.760 --> 00:01:43.905
Are we going to interact
with our users in some way?

35
00:01:43.905 --> 00:01:48.325
Are we going to need a forum, or some
other pieces that might come into this?

36
00:01:48.325 --> 00:01:51.905
So the purpose of the site will
help drive the design forward.

37
00:01:51.905 --> 00:01:54.835
So it's something you should consider
right before you even sit in front

38
00:01:54.835 --> 00:01:57.315
of Dreamweaver, and you start designing.

39
00:01:57.315 --> 00:02:00.340
Identify the target audience,
who will be visiting the site?

40
00:02:00.340 --> 00:02:02.260
Are they predominantly
going to be carpenters?

41
00:02:02.260 --> 00:02:04.320
Are they going to be technical people?

42
00:02:04.320 --> 00:02:08.180
Are they going to be people
who are purchasing shoes?

43
00:02:08.180 --> 00:02:11.440
Whatever the purpose is,
you've got to say who is this audience?

44
00:02:11.440 --> 00:02:16.108
Because, for example, if you're going
to gear it towards men, their gender,

45
00:02:16.108 --> 00:02:20.502
you might want to have some neutral
tones in there, some Earth tone colors,

46
00:02:20.502 --> 00:02:21.936
that kind of thing.

47
00:02:21.936 --> 00:02:22.900
If you're going to do it for

48
00:02:22.900 --> 00:02:27.160
women, you might want to have colors
that are more appealing to them.

49
00:02:27.160 --> 00:02:29.910
You might have designs that
are appealing to them.

50
00:02:29.910 --> 00:02:35.100
So that whole idea changes how
your site is going to go and

51
00:02:35.100 --> 00:02:36.540
what you're going to do on the site.

52
00:02:36.540 --> 00:02:40.200
It might even change some of
the content that you're going to allow.

53
00:02:40.200 --> 00:02:44.480
We might have more demonstration videos
if it is going to be one target audience.

54
00:02:44.480 --> 00:02:46.810
And it may have more
audio demonstrations or

55
00:02:46.810 --> 00:02:49.225
written demonstrations based on
the different type of audience.

56
00:02:49.225 --> 00:02:53.660
S,o very good points to make are who's the
target audience and what are the purpose?

57
00:02:53.660 --> 00:03:00.220
The next part is to organize the content
of the site so it's logical, okay?

58
00:03:00.220 --> 00:03:03.650
You've got to have that banner at
the top that brands your information.

59
00:03:03.650 --> 00:03:08.100
You've got to have the navigation bar,
clear and concise and easy to find, and

60
00:03:08.100 --> 00:03:09.640
you've got to have the content.

61
00:03:09.640 --> 00:03:12.090
The main content sections available and

62
00:03:12.090 --> 00:03:15.110
presenting the information in
a way that makes a lot of sense.

63
00:03:15.110 --> 00:03:17.900
So organization,
also the structure, right?

64
00:03:17.900 --> 00:03:19.150
So, we want to have some balance and

65
00:03:19.150 --> 00:03:21.930
make sure that it's going to meet
the need of what we're trying to deliver.

66
00:03:23.050 --> 00:03:25.020
Create a layout, an outline or

67
00:03:25.020 --> 00:03:30.580
a site diagram that might make your
navigation easier and user friendly.

68
00:03:30.580 --> 00:03:33.360
Your design for
your navigation is completely different

69
00:03:33.360 --> 00:03:38.060
if you're going to be designing for people
on a browser on a computer, then it is for

70
00:03:38.060 --> 00:03:40.480
somebody who's going to be on
a mobile device, for example.

71
00:03:40.480 --> 00:03:43.120
So you're going to have touch
inputs on the mobile devices,

72
00:03:43.120 --> 00:03:46.870
whereas on the computer, you're going to
have mice and keyboard interactivity.

73
00:03:46.870 --> 00:03:50.690
So that needs to be taken into
consideration when you design.

74
00:03:50.690 --> 00:03:54.870
So when we talk about using a site
diagram, you can use that later on

75
00:03:54.870 --> 00:03:58.910
as a site map usually listed somewhere
in the footer of your web pages.

76
00:03:58.910 --> 00:04:03.580
But the point is these will help make
the design better for everyone and

77
00:04:03.580 --> 00:04:05.070
better for your user.

78
00:04:05.070 --> 00:04:08.960
And that's the point, is to reach that
user in a way that they feel comfortable,

79
00:04:08.960 --> 00:04:11.000
and to make sure that the information
that they're looking for

80
